programme.title: Jestem tutaj
programme.desc: Niespodziewany przyjazd młodszego brata Stefana (Miłosz Frydrychowicz) zmusza dwudziestoletnią Hanię (Marianna Kowalewska) do zmierzenia się z trudną przeszłością i do odnowy kontaktu z dawno niewidzianą matką. Przez wzgląd na chłopaka dziewczyna musi dać szansę tej skomplikowanej relacji.

credits.actor: Marianna Kowalewska
Miłosz Frydrychowicz
Edyta Torhan
Michał Jaros

programme.title: Na strajk!
programme.desc: Dzień z życia 19-letniego Karola, który opiekuje się dziadkiem chorym na alzheimera. Niebawem chłopak poznaje tajemnicę rodzinną związaną z dramatycznymi wydarzeniami podczas stoczniowych strajków w grudniu 1970 roku. Odkryta przeszłość zmusza go do podjęcia najważniejszej decyzji w życiu.

credits.actor: Jadwiga Jankowska-Cieślak
Witold Dębicki
Jan Peszek
Jędrzej Wielecki

programme.title: Myszy i szczury
programme.desc: Dramatyczne losy małego Adasia (Miłosz Kwiecień), którego przykre doświadczenia sprzed lat odbijają się na psychice całej rodziny. Wzruszająca historia o bezgranicznej miłości, przeznaczeniu, poczuciu winy i ponoszeniu konsekwencji za swoje czyny.

programme.title: The Other Story
Cena prawdy
Sipur Acher
programme.desc: The Other Story: Directed by Avi Nesher. With Sasson Gabay, Joy Rieger, Yuval Segal, Maya Dagan. Two rebellious young women - one fleeing the chaos of secular hedonism for the disciplined comforts of faith; the other desperate to transcend her oppressive religious cross paths unexpectedly in Jerusalem, to startling consequences." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8510206/","name":"The Other Story","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWYwNGQxMDMtNDBiMC00OWYyLTk5NzMtOGNjMDlhYTY4YTY0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTQwMDA5NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two rebellious young women - one fleeing the chaos of secular hedonism for the disciplined comforts of faith; the other desperate to transcend her oppressive religious cross paths unexpectedly in Jerusalem, to startling consequences.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8510206/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"briefexistance"},"dateCreated":"2019-09-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Marvelous gem","reviewBody":"I'm so glad I saw this with the man himself presenting the film in the Monterrey Film Festival. Boom! the credits. When I least expect it, 2 hours have passed, I mean, not many films have that characteristic while maintaining the highest quality in terms of screenwriting and acting. I remember Avi Nesher said its movie don't have the traditional 3 act structure, which makes it very enjoyable in a fresh and interesting way. It was also very cool to watch a Israeli film without clichés or stereotypes, portraying their culture and millennial traditions with respect in a contemporary world. This is proof that if you want to make an incredibly fresh action film you don't need cars, explosions or serial murders. You need a good crew, you need to bring love to your work, you need courage to step outside the conventional boundaries without sacrificing the public's enjoyment. This exhales love and respect for the observer, and I really appreciate it. It's warm, it's interesting, it's new.\n\nBONUS! The song in the bar scene was BEAUTIFUL! I completely loved the quality of the sound, it was very rich and moving, even if I didn't understand a word.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":356,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-10-25","keywords":"morning ritual,netilat yadayim,airport,father daughter relationship,father son relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Other Story","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1876343833","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDI0YTk5NWMtNTNlZi00NTY4LTk1MDQtMGU3NDRkMTc0ZmNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDI0YTk5NWMtNTNlZi00NTY4LTk1MDQtMGU3NDRkMTc0ZmNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0299924/","name":"Sasson Gabay"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2380472/","name":"Joy Rieger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0781879/","name":"Yuval Segal"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0383605/","name":"Avi Nesher"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017558/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0707371/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10032060/","name":"Noam Shpancer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0383605/","name":"Avi Nesher"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ma part du gâteau
Mój kawałek tortu
Ma part du gâteau
programme.desc:
Ma part du gâteau: Directed by Cédric Klapisch. With Karin Viard, Gilles Lellouche, Audrey Lamy, Jean-Pierre Martins. After losing her job at a local factory, a single mother enrolls in a housekeeper training program, soon landing work cleaning the Paris apartment of handsome but cocky power broker." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1641624/","name":"Ma part du gâteau","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzg3ZWRkZjItZTVlOC00Zjc2LWI2YzgtMDJkMTBiMmQ2Y2FlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODIyOTEyMzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"After losing her job at a local factory, a single mother enrolls in a housekeeper training program, soon landing work cleaning the Paris apartment of handsome but cocky power broker.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1641624/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gerry-taylor-537-121512"},"dateCreated":"2014-05-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great Film","reviewBody":"Hi

This is a great film I cannot understand the low score, some of the earlier reviewers got the point some missed it.

Its the story of a redundant woman who goes to work for the trader who helped close down the firm she worked for.

I's about class struggle, family , globalization,love, powerless of the individual.

And also it dose n't really take sides as it shows the trader as a victim too.

Might be the best film I've seen in the past year.

Gerry","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2156,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2011-03-16","keywords":"single mother,predatory capitalism,capitalism,jobless,resisting arrest","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3307052569","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMzNTY4MDQ2M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjY0NzcwNw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMzNTY4MDQ2M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjY0NzcwNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"After losing her job at a local factory, a single mother enrolls in a housekeeper training program, soon landing work cleaning the Paris apartment of handsome but cocky power broker."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0895759/","name":"Karin Viard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0500976/","name":"Gilles Lellouche"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2188804/","name":"Audrey Lamy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0458251/","name":"Cédric Klapisch"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056755/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0458251/","name":"Cédric Klapisch"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

Class Action
programme.desc: Class Action: Directed by Michael Apted. With Gene Hackman, Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio, Colin Friels, Joanna Merlin. An attorney representing a traumatized accident victim finds that his opponent is a very familiar defense attorney - his own daughter." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0101590/","name":"Class Action","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWY5Mjk4ZmItMTAzYS00NWE3LWEzYzYtNDgzY2MwMzA3MDIzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzc5MjA3OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An attorney representing a traumatized accident victim finds that his opponent is a very familiar defense attorney - his own daughter.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0101590/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"stuprince"},"dateCreated":"2003-05-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Worth a watch, but too slow","reviewBody":"The idea, great. the actors, terrific. The plot, solid. the outcome, OK at best. Class Action has its moments, but spends way too much time developing the father-daughter relationship. Just as you get into the dirty dealings of the law firm, the director and editors give us more forced relationship. This is worth a look, but only if on TV."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7376,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1991-03-15","keywords":"judicial,judiciary,judicial system,foxvideo,man uses a wheelchair","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000432/","name":"Gene Hackman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001512/","name":"Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0295506/","name":"Colin Friels"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000776/","name":"Michael Apted"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031772/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0790960/","name":"Carolyn Shelby"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0024686/","name":"Christopher Ames"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0787154/","name":"Samantha Shad"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The New Daughter
Córka
The New Daughter
programme.desc:
The New Daughter: Directed by Luiso Berdejo. With Kevin Costner, Ivana Baquero, Samantha Mathis, Gattlin Griffith. A single father moves his two children to rural South Carolina, only to watch his daughter exhibit increasingly strange behavior." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0951335/","name":"The New Daughter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNTQ2MzM4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTgzNDcyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A single father moves his two children to rural South Carolina, only to watch his daughter exhibit increasingly strange behavior.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0951335/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bransurghon"},"dateCreated":"2010-07-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Considering The Source, Movie Is True To Form","reviewBody":"In todays, "no imagination, every bit of story must be spelled out on screen in action and with explosions" it is often to appreciate movies that make you think, draw conclusions, actually use you imagination and remember the source.

This movie is true to the short story it is based on with a good cinematic backdrop where the actors act, and everything isn't carried out on a blue/green screen. Costner's portrayal was very true to the actual character which, isn't that the point of having characters and using actors that can act.

programme.title: Mark Felt: The Man Who Brought Down the White House
Tajne źródło
Mark Felt: The Man Who Brought Down the White House
programme.desc:
Mark Felt: The Man Who Brought Down the White House: Directed by Peter Landesman. With Liam Neeson, Diane Lane, Marton Csokas, Tony Goldwyn. The story of Mark Felt, who under the name "Deep Throat" helped journalists Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein uncover the Watergate scandal in 1972." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5175450/","name":"Mark Felt: The Man Who Brought Down the White House","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQzMDEwMjMyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjA1NTA1MzI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of Mark Felt, who under the name "Deep Throat" helped journalists Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein uncover the Watergate scandal in 1972.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5175450/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jdesando"},"dateCreated":"2017-10-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's another turn on history you'll want to know.","reviewBody":"Astonishing: The most famous whistle blower in history gets his own docudrama, and it's a bit dull. Mark Felt (Liam Neeson), aka "Deep Throat," is tag lined in the movie's title as "the man who brought down the White House." The 2005 Vanity Fair article finally told the story, and this rendition hints at much intrigue left untold. It's the other side of All the President's Men but not nearly as well done.

As the deputy associate director of the FBI, Felt knew so much that he couldn't be fired for fear he'd reveal all. Yes, he had control of Hoover's "private files" (lots of sexual indiscretions) after his death in 1972, and he had 31 years of service. To boot, he was a straight arrow whom the dirty tricksters in the White House should have feared.

So how could this be a dull story? In the first place, the secret actions by the Watergate burglars and the foul machinations of Nixon's henchmen are barely exposed as drama. More importantly, the seminal investigative gymnastics of Woodward and Bernstein are skimmed over in favor of a Dustin Hoffman lookalike (Julian Morris) as Woodward (Redford played it in All) looking star struck when Felt begins his covert revelations. More integral is Sandy Smith (Bruce Greenwood) of Time Magazine as felt unloads info on him as well.

While we are left with a Cliff's Notes superficial version of the events leading to Nixon's resignation, we endure the domestic dilemmas of a boozy wife (Diane Lane) disappointed that Felt was passed over for director and a missing daughter, embarrassingly attached to a commune, we find out eventually. In the latter detail rests a better story of how Felt investigated Weatherman activities with a conflict of interest angle related to his daughter. (Reagan commuted Felt's sentence for unauthorized searches).

That is to say, there is so much action in those early '70's related to Tricky Dick that the movie seems to leave behind as it gets the right angles for its many Neeson close-ups. More close-ups of the FBI activity would have been better. All the President's Men and Spotlight are far better giving you the daily details leading to their disclosures.

But, hey, it is instructive to see that 45 years ago, the FBI asserted its independence from the White House. It had a sleazy administration to buck, all the more reason to fight the good fight. If you think there is resonance today with James Comey's firing, then hope for a Deep Throat. Looks like there are candidates already working out there."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12821,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2017-09-29","keywords":"washington post,whistleblower,father daughter relationship,mother daughter relationship,hippie","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi52345113","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU3MzAwNjg4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDYxNjczMzI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU3MzAwNjg4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDYxNjczMzI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of Mark Felt, who under the name "Deep Throat" helped journalists Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein uncover the Watergate scandal in 1974."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000553/","name":"Liam Neeson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000178/","name":"Diane Lane"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0190744/","name":"Marton Csokas"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1481618/","name":"Peter Landesman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0742273/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0515853/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0535275/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1944541/","name":"Mark Felt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2207084/","name":"John D. O'Connor"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1481618/","name":"Peter Landesman"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Simpatico
Simpatico
programme.desc:
Simpatico: Directed by Matthew Warchus. With Nick Nolte, Jeff Bridges, Sharon Stone, Catherine Keener. After scams at horse races and making lots of money, 3 young people split. 20 years later, one of them, a drunk, creates chaos with photos from back then." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0174204/","name":"Simpatico","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzE5YjQ0MjItOTNhMS00NTliLWJjYmEtMTE1NTExNjRlZjRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"After scams at horse races and making lots of money, 3 young people split. 20 years later, one of them, a drunk, creates chaos with photos from back then.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0174204/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"adnixon"},"dateCreated":"2001-07-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Disappointment","reviewBody":"I like Jeff Bridges tremendously, so I'll watch anything with him in. But this film has so many loose ends, you could make a ragrug.

Good acting by all, but a good dollop of suspension of disbelief is necessary with so many unlikely events or inconclusive nuances of the plot. Vinnie and his girlfriend checking into the same hotel and not knowing it. What was that all about? And what was Carter arranging with Simms anyway even before Vinnie turns up from the past?

The central premise seemed to be Simms's reconciliation with the past - forgive and forget. Very good, but this wasn't developed enough. Okay Carter throws it all away through guilt and wants the simple life again. But it's not believable. They can't be nineteen again.

It should have been filmed in the European style - slow and ponderous would have been so much better. But this version is too clipped and compromised with modern moviegoers tastes. Stone is very very good. Nice to see Nolte in rags again, it's his forte. Jeff is sleepwalking though. New girl terrific. Does she go back to Vinnie in the end or go with Simms? I think it's back to Vinnie. It almost works - I like movies that exercise the mind and leave loose ends to speculate on. But without the basic substance, loose ends is all Simpatico has."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3563,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2000-01-28","keywords":"kentucky,blackmail,scam,woman smoker,volkswagen beetle","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Simpatico","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2659385625","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2JiYTA1MjItM2ZkNS00NTFhLWJiNjYtN2FhNjhmOWY3NDcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2JiYTA1MjItM2ZkNS00NTFhLWJiNjYtN2FhNjhmOWY3NDcxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Fine Line"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000560/","name":"Nick Nolte"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000313/","name":"Jeff Bridges"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000232/","name":"Sharon Stone"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911334/","name":"Matthew Warchus"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093471/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010090/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001731/","name":"Sam Shepard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911334/","name":"Matthew Warchus"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0390141/","name":"David Nicholls"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

Kochanie, chyba cię zabiłem
programme.desc: Kochanie, chyba cie zabilem: Directed by Jakub Niescierow. With Zbigniew Zamachowski, Arkadiusz Jakubik, Ireneusz Czop, Marcin Korcz. An employee at a video rental shop accidentally discovers a recording of a murder. The killer is the husband, the victim is his unfaithful wife. Hoping for easy money, the kid decides to blackmail the husband. Together, they set off to the coast, where the killer keeps his saving in a bank deposit. programme.title: London Town
London Town
programme.desc:
London Town: Directed by Derrick Borte. With Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Daniel Huttlestone, Dougray Scott, Natascha McElhone. In '70s London, a 14 year-old boy is introduced to the Clash by his estranged mother. It changes his life forever." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1724597/","name":"London Town","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc3NjU2MjYzOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTk4NzgwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"In '70s London, a 14 year-old boy is introduced to the Clash by his estranged mother. It changes his life forever.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1724597/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"katzco-545-81470"},"dateCreated":"2016-10-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"A film that is music for the eyes, the ears and the heart!","reviewBody":"Every once in a while a little film, with a tiny budget and a whole lot of heart, comes along and knocks you off your feet. London Town fulfills all the aspects of that category. 

I won't bother to give you a blow by blow description of the story, that's easily found elsewhere. I will tell you I was more than thoroughly entertained and, since it was a 48 hour rental via my VOD system, I took the opportunity to watch it three times because it was just that good! The film is endearing, funny and the performances are stellar, especially the youngsters. Huttlestone is already on his way as a multi-talent, but Nell Williams was a new revelation for me and she shines here. 

If for no other reason, you need to see this film for the incredibly brilliant work of Jonathan Rhys Meyers as Joe Strummer. He is simply mesmerizing and delivers a musical performance equal to that of any contemporary or historical rock star. (As a veteran of 7 Stones and 14 WHO concerts, I feel justified in that statement.) Derrick Borte managed to assemble a superb group of musicians to portray the rest of the band and the results are magical. 

London Town is a special film, with something for everyone to love. Don't miss it!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2297,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2016-10-07","keywords":"the clash,pantyhose,miniskirt,fishnet pantyhose,losing virginity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3651909145","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4NDMyMTU2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTM1MDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM4NDMyMTU2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTM1MDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 70's London, a teenager is introduced to The Clash by his estranged mother and it changes his life forever."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001667/","name":"Jonathan Rhys Meyers"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4948519/","name":"Daniel Huttlestone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0779084/","name":"Dougray Scott"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0097517/","name":"Derrick Borte"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0296298/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030755/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0375102/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0114226/","name":"Matt Brown"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0839503/","name":"Sonya Gildea"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0792202/","name":"Kirsten Sheridan"}],"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Dialog
programme.desc: Björn Andrésen miał 15 lat, gdy w 1971 roku zagrał u włoskiego reżysera Luchino Viscontiego rolę Tadzia w "Śmierci w Wenecji". Zdobył nią międzynarodową sławę. Sukces stał się jednak jego przekleństwem. Obecnie mężczyzna walczy z demonami przeszłości. Rozpamiętuje śmierć matki i traumy przeżyte na planie filmowym. Mówi również o chorobie alkoholowej.

programme.title: The Most Beautiful Boy in the World
Najpiękniejszy chłopiec na świecie
Världens vackraste pojke
programme.desc: The Most Beautiful Boy in the World: Directed by Kristina Lindström, Kristian Petri. With Annike Andresen, Björn Andrésen, Silva Filmer, Riyoko Ikeda. In 1971, due to the world premiere of Death in Venice, Italian director Luchino Visconti proclaimed his Tadzio as the world's most beautiful boy. 50 years later, that shadow still weighs upon Björn Andresen's life." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8801666/","name":"The Most Beautiful Boy in the World","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWRjODgyODUtZWJlNi00OTc3LTlhMmQtNzA2Zjc2M2M4MDY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDExMzMxNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 1971, due to the world premiere of Death in Venice, Italian director Luchino Visconti proclaimed his Tadzio as the world's most beautiful boy. 50 years later, that shadow still weighs upon Björn Andresen's life.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8801666/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kozakiewiczjulia"},"dateCreated":"2021-09-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Could've been a great one","reviewBody":"This film could have been a true gem. Sadly, the fascinating background story of Luchino Visconti's "Death in Venice" quickly dissolves into a diluted, weird, shallow and to be honest simply boring exploration of what happened to the most beautiful boy in the world (without at all creating an in-depth portrait). All of the most interesting moments and crucial story parts were actually in the trailer which is great, but there's not much more to this film than the trailer.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":601,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2021-10-15","keywords":"beach,death in venice,exploitation,old man,japan","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm12155251/","name":"Annike Andresen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001909/","name":"Björn Andrésen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm12155254/","name":"Silva Filmer"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4695054/","name":"Kristina Lindström"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0677892/","name":"Kristian Petri"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0533102/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4695054/","name":"Kristina Lindström"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0677892/","name":"Kristian Petri"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Normandie nue
Naga Normandia
Normandie nue
programme.desc: Normandie nue: Directed by Philippe Le Guay. With François Cluzet, François-Xavier Demaison, Julie-Anne Roth, Pili Groyne. A French mayor has to convince his villagers to pose naked for an American photographer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6923840/","name":"Normandie nue","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ5NzgyNjUtMmMyYS00MWI3LThlMzYtYjY0YzA5MzhiM2FlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc5OTQwMzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A French mayor has to convince his villagers to pose naked for an American photographer.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6923840/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mmunier"},"dateCreated":"2018-11-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"A poile Nearly Au poile!","reviewBody":"I can see the rating so far is 5.5 and I'm in agreement with this - slightly above average for me. In case you don't get my title , if you've seen the movie you probably know that "a poile" means 'naked'. Poile in french is body hair (head hair is 'cheveu' ) so 'a poile' is reminiscent of English 'Birthday suit'. As for "Au poile" it means 'perfect' (to the precision of one hair) - Non related but for your information; when one make things unnecessary difficult the expression is "couper les cheveux en quatre" Split hairS (this time head hair) in four" yes usually head hair in french is pluralised! Perhaps in English it's understood 'split hair' means in thousand parts!) I did not find the 'nakedness' idea very original after "The full Monty" and by now the use of nude calendars to promote whatever group or cause. Neither did i think there was much to save the village in the given proposition so again it was a little of a loss for me But there were some funny moments. I am a fan of Francois Cluzet and enjoyed many of his movies. This one was was more pleasant than pleasing for me . On my phone I read a critic mentioning that the subtitles were missing when English was spoken. I think it's often the case and not good for my wife and I who go to see foreign movies mainly because our defective hearing ability and know we'll get subtitles. I hope one day technology will provide some kind of glasses that shows subtitles for those who need them! But as an ex dairy farmer worker I could identify with quite a few of rural and agricultural situation although I have never had issues with the Germans or the Romanians. Else there was much of it. The ending was for me a little too "watered down" and somehow quite predictable. IMDb data; ttnr: 6923840, Title: Normandie nue, --- Description: Normandie nue: Directed by Philippe Le Guay. With François Cluzet, François-Xavier Demaison, Julie-Anne Roth, Pili Groyne. A French mayor has to convince his villagers to pose naked for an American photographer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6923840/","name":"Normandie nue","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ5NzgyNjUtMmMyYS00MWI3LThlMzYtYjY0YzA5MzhiM2FlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc5OTQwMzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A French mayor has to convince his villagers to pose naked for an American photographer.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6923840/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mmunier","dateCreated":"2018-11-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"A poile Nearly Au poile!","reviewBody":"I can see the rating so far is 5.5 and I'm in agreement with this - slightly above average for me. In case you don't get my title , if you've seen the movie you probably know that "a poile" means 'naked'. Poile in french is body hair (head hair is 'cheveu' ) so 'a poile' is reminiscent of English 'Birthday suit'. As for "Au poile" it means 'perfect' (to the precision of one hair) - Non related but for your information; when one make things unnecessary difficult the expression is "couper les cheveux en quatre" Split hairS (this time head hair) in four" yes usually head hair in french is pluralised! Perhaps in English it's understood 'split hair' means in thousand parts!) I did not find the 'nakedness' idea very original after "The full Monty" and by now the use of nude calendars to promote whatever group or cause. Neither did i think there was much to save the village in the given proposition so again it was a little of a loss for me But there were some funny moments. I am a fan of Francois Cluzet and enjoyed many of his movies. This one was was more pleasant than pleasing for me . On my phone I read a critic mentioning that the subtitles were missing when English was spoken. I think it's often the case and not good for my wife and I who go to see foreign movies mainly because our defective hearing ability and know we'll get subtitles. I hope one day technology will provide some kind of glasses that shows subtitles for those who need them! But as an ex dairy farmer worker I could identify with quite a few of rural and agricultural situation although I have never had issues with the Germans or the Romanians. Else there was much of it. The ending was for me a little too "watered down" and somehow quite predictable. I was a little skeptic of the glamourous reviews on the papers so was not really disappointed as I toned down my expectation.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":989,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9,"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-01-10","keywords":"female full frontal nudity,male full frontal nudity,public nudity,female full rear nudity,male full rear nudity","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1722333977","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWIwYjQ4YmItNzhmZS00MzhiLWEwMDItZDg3OTdkZWJiMTBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWIwYjQ4YmItNzhmZS00MzhiLWEwMDItZDg3OTdkZWJiMTBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0167388/","name":"François Cluzet","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1687404/","name":"François-Xavier Demaison","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0712208/","name":"Julie-Anne Roth"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0494355/","name":"Philippe Le Guay"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0021808/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0025026/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056755/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2605079/","name":"Victoria Bedos","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0206797/","name":"Olivier Dazat","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0494355/","name":"Philippe Le Guay"],"duration":"PT1H45M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Philippe Le Guay

programme.title: Notturno
Notturno
programme.desc:
Notturno: Directed by Gianfranco Rosi. Gianfranco Rosi's new documentary is an immersive portrait of those trying to survive in the war-torn Middle East." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7945450/","name":"Notturno","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzk0NGVhM2ItZDk0NC00MTUzLTljODktMTA2NWY2NGFkN2VhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"Gianfranco Rosi's new documentary is an immersive portrait of those trying to survive in the war-torn Middle East.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7945450/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JohannesBlack"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Tragedy and Poetry","reviewBody":"Several years ago, Gianfranco Rosi lectured to an audience of university students (myself included) about his next project: it would be filmed exclusively at night, he said, and take place over much of the Middle East. He asked that we not release any of this information - assured of the secret pact with his audience. I had more or less forgotten about this project until recently, when I discovered it had been selected as the Italian entry for the Best International Feature Film at the 93rd Academy Awards, and was being distributed by MUBI.

Notturno ("night," or "of the night") is a collection of brief glimpses into the lives of people across Syria, Lebanon, Iraq and the Kurdistan region of northern Iraq. From dark swamplands to inner cities, fisherman, soldiers and teachers, to name a few, are brought into the documentary's compass. Few words are spoken by those selected, and much of their action or routine takes place in quietness - a sort of calm in the aftermath of a terrible storm. Rosi's observational and distant study only partly takes places at night; many scenes are filmed in the soft glow of dawn or twilight, and many in bright sunlight.

For a while, I was sceptical about the documentary's artistic license. There is near-perfect composition to each frame, and the theatrical recreation of war by the amateur, psychiatric patients reminded me of Joshua Oppenheimer's The Act of Killing (where civilians and dictators are made to dramatise the traumas of their past). And yet, I found myself compelled by Notturno's visual storytelling, by the sparseness of its landscapes and sound. There are stories within these images, and sometimes they need to speak for themselves, without the aid of conventional narration or voiceover.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1012,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2020-09-09","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3691495705","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzQ4MTMxMWYtYzIxOC00YjY0LWE0OTAtYWY1NTY5MTVhOGNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzQ4MTMxMWYtYzIxOC00YjY0LWE0OTAtYWY1NTY5MTVhOGNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Filmed over three years on the borders between Iraq, Kurdistan, Syria and Lebanon, Notturno captures the everyday life that lies behind the continuing tragedy of civil wars, ferocious dictatorships, foreign invasions and the murderous apocalypse of ISIS. Gianfranco Rosi (SACRO GRA, Venice Golden Lion Winner, FIRE AT SEA, Berlin Golden Bear winner and Oscar® nominee)constructs a sublime cinematic journey through the region finding peace and light within the chaos and despair in the aftermath of war. A mosaic of intimate moments and luminous images, Notturno is a profound and urgent cinematic achievement, from a master of the documentary form."},"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0742941/","name":"Gianfranco Rosi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0515969/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0369215/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0055455/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0742941/","name":"Gianfranco Rosi"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Official Secrets
Brudna gra
Official Secrets
programme.desc: Official Secrets: Directed by Gavin Hood. With Keira Knightley, Matt Smith, Matthew Goode, Rhys Ifans. The true story of a British whistleblower who leaked information to the press about an illegal NSA spy operation designed to push the UN Security Council into sanctioning the 2003 invasion of Iraq." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5431890/","name":"Official Secrets","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjY1NWYwZmEtNGE3Ny00YTZhLThmZTMtNGI2MDY0MGU5YmJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY3Nzc0OTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"The true story of a British whistleblower who leaked information to the press about an illegal NSA spy operation designed to push the UN Security Council into sanctioning the 2003 invasion of Iraq.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5431890/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jhwaldo"},"dateCreated":"2019-06-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Brilliant screenplay, superb acting!","reviewBody":"The screenwriting magic of the incredibly talented husband and wife team of Bernstein and Bernstein bring this true story filled with spies, treason, love and war to the big screen. Though a true story and the ending is known, this film has the viewer balanced on the edge of their seat with suspense. Kiera Knightly's best performance to date and Ralph Fiennes is brilliant as her lawyer. Every performance is excellent in this must see film when it premieres in August 2019. (Viewed at the Nantucket Film Festival June 2019)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":42534,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-08-30","keywords":"whistleblower,courtroom,cafe,british politics,spy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4129995801","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWE3Njg0NjctOTk0ZC00YjNjLWI5OGEtMWMyYmI4YTFhZWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWE3Njg0NjctOTk0ZC00YjNjLWI5OGEtMWMyYmI4YTFhZWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of Katharine Gun (Keira Knightley), a British intelligence specialist whose job involves routine handling of classified information. One day in 2003, in the lead up to the Iraq War, Gun receives a memo from the NSA with a shocking directive: the United States is enlisting Britain's help in collecting compromising information on United Nations Security Council members in order to blackmail them into voting in favor of an invasion of Iraq. Unable to stand by and watch the world be rushed into an illegal war, Gun makes the decision to defy her government and leak the memo to the press. So begins an explosive chain of events that will ignite an international firestorm, expose a vast political conspiracy, and put Gun and her family directly in harm's way."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0461136/","name":"Keira Knightley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1741002/","name":"Matt Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0328828/","name":"Matthew Goode"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004303/","name":"Gavin Hood"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051618/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0760923/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0681278/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0077135/","name":"Sara Bernstein"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0077052/","name":"Gregory Bernstein"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004303/","name":"Gavin Hood"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Nightbreed

Nightbreed
programme.desc: Nightbreed: Directed by Clive Barker. With Craig Sheffer, Anne Bobby, David Cronenberg, Charles Haid. A troubled young man is drawn to a mythical place called Midian where a variety of friendly monsters are hiding from humanity. programme.title: Anneliese: The Exorcist Tapes
Anneliese: The Exorcist Tapes
programme.desc:
Anneliese: The Exorcist Tapes: Directed by Jude Gerard Prest. With Yaz Canli, Kai Cofer, Christopher Karl Johnson, Nikki Muller. In the tradition of PARANORMAL ACTIVITY, found footage documents the real life exorcisms of Anneliese Michel, history's most notorious victim of demonic possession." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1911533/","name":"Anneliese: The Exorcist Tapes","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE1MTk5NTE0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjQyNTA5Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the tradition of PARANORMAL ACTIVITY, found footage documents the real life exorcisms of Anneliese Michel, history's most notorious victim of demonic possession.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1911533/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Platypuschow"},"dateCreated":"2019-02-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Anneliese The Exorcist Tapes: Exploitative","reviewBody":"The Exorcist Tapes is the third movie in the very loose Paranormal Entity/Investigations franchise and is made by infamous production company The Asylum (Who I'm sure I don't need to introduce).

It tells the true story of Anneliese Michel and the case of her supposed exorcism and the two warring factions who tried to decide her fate. The doctors who wanted her to go to a hospital and seek medical treatment and the parents/priests who deemed her possessed and demanded she be subject to an exorcism.

The movie plays out as if it's real footage of the event which I find a tad exploitative and in bad taste considering the true story, what happened and the fate that Anneliese was finally dealt.

In true Paranormal Entity and Asylum tradition the movie looks ugly, has no budget behind it, has a mediocre cast and people behind the camera who must have just graduated amateur film school.

If you want to know the story of Ms.Michel then google it, maybe watch the documentary but leave this nonsense in the cold where it belongs.

The Good:

Nope

The Bad:

Rather bad taste pretending it's real footage based on what actually happened

Everything is just so poor","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":839,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":2.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror"],"datePublished":"2011-03-01","keywords":"found footage,demonic possession,exorcism,documentary style,loosely based on real events","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2540932/","name":"Yaz Canli"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1854538/","name":"Kai Cofer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2562008/","name":"Christopher Karl Johnson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0313962/","name":"Jude Gerard Prest"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042909/"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1911533, Title: Anneliese: The Exorcist Tapes, --- Description: Anneliese: The Exorcist Tapes: Directed by Jude Gerard Prest. With Yaz Canli, Kai Cofer, Christopher Karl Johnson, Nikki Muller. In the tradition of PARANORMAL ACTIVITY, found footage documents the real life exorcisms of Anneliese Michel, history's most notorious victim of demonic possession." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1911533/","name":"Anneliese: The Exorcist Tapes","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE1MTk5NTE0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjQyNTA5Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the tradition of PARANORMAL ACTIVITY, found footage documents the real life exorcisms of Anneliese Michel, history's most notorious victim of demonic possession.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1911533/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Platypuschow","dateCreated":"2019-02-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Anneliese The Exorcist Tapes: Exploitative","reviewBody":"The Exorcist Tapes is the third movie in the very loose Paranormal Entity/Investigations franchise and is made by infamous production company The Asylum (Who I'm sure I don't need to introduce).

It tells the true story of Anneliese Michel and the case of her supposed exorcism and the two warring factions who tried to decide her fate. The doctors who wanted her to go to a hospital and seek medical treatment and the parents/priests who deemed her possessed and demanded she be subject to an exorcism.

The movie plays out as if it's real footage of the event which I find a tad exploitative and in bad taste considering the true story, what happened and the fate that Anneliese was finally dealt.

In true Paranormal Entity and Asylum tradition the movie looks ugly, has no budget behind it, has a mediocre cast and people behind the camera who must have just graduated amateur film school.

If you want to know the story of Ms.Michel then google it, maybe watch the documentary but leave this nonsense in the cold where it belongs.

The Good:

Nope

The Bad:

Rather bad taste pretending it's real footage based on what actually happened

Everything is just so poor","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":839,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":2.9,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror"],"datePublished":"2011-03-01","keywords":"found footage,demonic possession,exorcism,documentary style,loosely based on real events","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2540932/","name":"Yaz Canli","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1854538/","name":"Kai Cofer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2562008/","name":"Christopher Karl Johnson"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0313962/","name":"Jude Gerard Prest"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042909/"],"duration":"PT1H31M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Jude Gerard Prest

programme.title: Carnage Park
Park makabry
Carnage Park
programme.desc: Carnage Park: Directed by Mickey Keating. With Ashley Bell, Pat Healy, James Landry Hébert, Michael Villar. Part crime caper gone awry, part survival horror film, this 1970s set thriller depicts a harrowing fight for survival after a pair of wannabe crooks botch a bank heist and flee into the desert, where they inexplicably stumble upon Carnage Park, a remote stretch of wilderness occupied by a psychotic ex-military sniper." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4335650/","name":"Carnage Park","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE3MTA2MTQ0Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzkxNTAwOTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Part crime caper gone awry, part survival horror film, this 1970s set thriller depicts a harrowing fight for survival after a pair of wannabe crooks botch a bank heist and flee into the desert, where they inexplicably stumble upon Ca","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4335650/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Fella_shibby"},"dateCreated":"2016-10-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Boring n unnecessarily lengthy. The shaky cam, flickering lights n blank dark screens will give u headache.","reviewBody":"The movie started well. Killer with a sniper gun. Pat Heally acted like a true psychopath. His facial expressions n accent is good. The deserted highway, bank robbery, hostage, all these gav me hope that this might b another Wolf Creek or another good thriller. I was wrong. The movie went downhill. Inspite of being only around 77 mins, i found the movie very tedious. At times i felt like switching off the movie. The soundtrack is awful. Larry Fessenden is jus there for few mins. Some of the scenes were so badly shot that I felt like turning my face away. Shaky cam, hand held, flickering lights in darkness were too tedious for me. Some scenes jus went blank (dark screen). I don't know what purpose does that serve. So many clichés. 1)When u take down/beat up a villain/creature/psycho, make sure that they r dead or completely down. 2)Whenever the main lead is terrified he/she accidentally stabs a scissor or a knife in an innocent person.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3474,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Action","Crime","Horror"],"datePublished":"2016-07-01","keywords":"survival,game of death,escape,psychopath,psycho killer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1236514585","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg0NDY0MDI2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3ODIyOTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg0NDY0MDI2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3ODIyOTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"It's 1978 and a bank robbery gone wrong leaves Vivian the hostage of two criminals on the run. But things go from bad to off-the-rails berserk when she and her captors wind up on the sun-baked desert outpost of a deranged ex-military sniper, who ensnares them in his deadly game of cat and mouse."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0068042/","name":"Ashley Bell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0372366/","name":"Pat Healy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2566469/","name":"James Landry Hébert"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4806266/","name":"Mickey Keating"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0497026/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4806266/","name":"Mickey Keating"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Moguls
Amatorski projekt
The Moguls
programme.desc: The Moguls: Directed by Michael Traeger. With Jeff Bridges, Tim Blake Nelson, Joe Pantoliano, Ted Danson. Citizens of a small town, under the influence of a man in the midst of a mid-life crisis, come together to make an adult film." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0405163/","name":"The Moguls","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYyNzQyOTQzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTYxNjQzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Citizens of a small town, under the influence of a man in the midst of a mid-life crisis, come together to make an adult film.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0405163/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bgpetrarca"},"dateCreated":"2006-04-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"How could you not like this movie?","reviewBody":"For those of you in search of a movie that will make you laugh, here is your pick. I have read comments from users saying that this movie "didn't seem real" or "wasn't believable". To you, I ask: What did you think you were watching? I saw this screening at the Newport Film Festival and thought it was amazing. Some movies (gasp) are out there to entertain and this does just that... fantastically. It is a story that laughs at the ups and downs of the human experience while portraying the sometimes very harsh reality of middle-class struggle. It gives us a story we recognize to a certain extent, but garnishes it with a great variety of endearing characters. As an example the group of "guys" has a wonderfully accepted gay guy who asked the guys to call him MOOSE. (played oh-so-well by Ted Danson) We see the standard group of small town guys, going nowhere with their lives, yet they aren't the stereotypical unrelatable morons of modern day cinema; They, in a very round about and strange way, have morals and try to do well in life, despite their position. Go see this movie... it is a wonderful treat and a great time at the theatre.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6326,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2006-04-28","keywords":"small town,loser,adult filmmaking,pornographic film,hot","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Amateurs","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2207580441","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmJkZDkwNzktZDNiMS00NzFhLThhYTktM2FhZDg5ODQ2ZjcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmJkZDkwNzktZDNiMS00NzFhLThhYTktM2FhZDg5ODQ2ZjcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for The Amateurs"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000313/","name":"Jeff Bridges"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001101/","name":"Ted Danson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001592/","name":"Joe Pantoliano"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0870592/","name":"Michael Traeger"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010508/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0102795/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0107069/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0870592/","name":"Michael Traeger"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0405163, Title: The Moguls, --- Description: The Moguls: Directed by Michael Traeger. With Jeff Bridges, Tim Blake Nelson, Joe Pantoliano, Ted Danson. Citizens of a small town, under the influence of a man in the midst of a mid-life crisis, come together to make an adult film." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0405163/","name":"The Moguls","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYyNzQyOTQzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTYxNjQzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Citizens of a small town, under the influence of a man in the midst of a mid-life crisis, come together to make an adult film.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0405163/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"bgpetrarca","dateCreated":"2006-04-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"How could you not like this movie?","reviewBody":"For those of you in search of a movie that will make you laugh, here is your pick. I have read comments from users saying that this movie "didn't seem real" or "wasn't believable". To you, I ask: What did you think you were watching? I saw this screening at the Newport Film Festival and thought it was amazing. Some movies (gasp) are out there to entertain and this does just that... fantastically. It is a story that laughs at the ups and downs of the human experience while portraying the sometimes very harsh reality of middle-class struggle. It gives us a story we recognize to a certain extent, but garnishes it with a great variety of endearing characters. As an example the group of "guys" has a wonderfully accepted gay guy who asked the guys to call him MOOSE. (played oh-so-well by Ted Danson) We see the standard group of small town guys, going nowhere with their lives, yet they aren't the stereotypical unrelatable morons of modern day cinema; They, in a very round about and strange way, have morals and try to do well in life, despite their position. Go see this movie... it is a wonderful treat and a great time at the theatre.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6326,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2006-04-28","keywords":"small town,loser,adult filmmaking,pornographic film,hot","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Amateurs","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2207580441","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmJkZDkwNzktZDNiMS00NzFhLThhYTktM2FhZDg5ODQ2ZjcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmJkZDkwNzktZDNiMS00NzFhLThhYTktM2FhZDg5ODQ2ZjcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for The Amateurs","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000313/","name":"Jeff Bridges","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001101/","name":"Ted Danson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001592/","name":"Joe Pantoliano"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0870592/","name":"Michael Traeger"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010508/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0102795/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0107069/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0870592/","name":"Michael Traeger"],"duration":"PT1H36M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Michael Traeger

programme.title: Interstate 60: Episodes of the Road
Ale jazda!
Interstate 60: Episodes of the Road
programme.desc:
Interstate 60: Episodes of the Road: Directed by Bob Gale. With Matthew Edison, Paul Brogren, Wayne Robson, Gary Oldman. Neal Oliver, a very confused young man and an artist, takes a journey of a lifetime on a highway I60 that doesn't exist on any of the maps, going to the places he never even heard of, searching for an answer and his dreamgirl." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0165832/","name":"Interstate 60: Episodes of the Road","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDYwYzlhOTAtNDAwMC00ZTBhLWI4M2QtMTA1NmJhYTdiNTkxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTM0NTU5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Neal Oliver, a very confused young man and an artist, takes a journey of a lifetime on a highway I60 that doesn't exist on any of the maps, going to the places he never even heard of, searching for an answer and his dreamgirl.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0165832/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"scooterbrowne"},"dateCreated":"2004-01-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Say What You Mean and Mean What You Say (Possible Spoilers)","reviewBody":"From the man, Bob Gale, that gave us the Back to The Future trilogy comes Interstate 60. A story that everyone can pretty much relate to.

Well I say that this is one of the best movies that I have ever seen and I mean that 100%. This movie relates so much to life and shows you the results of the decisions that you make.

I waited so long to see this that I marked on my calender the day it would come out on DVD so I could go rent it at my local video store. When I first started watching it I wasn't to sure about it but by the time it was over I was sitting there amazed that a movie this good couldn't find distribution for so long and had to be put out as a direct to video release, especially with all the crap being put out at the theaters. I also couldn't wait to watch it again so I went out and bought it.

I thought the story was really good though I think the language was over the top. To me this movie was basically what everyone goes through in life. Finding that dream girl/guy, drugs, pressure from a parent/guardian,and wanting an answer to life.

The actors did a great job and Chris Cooper was hysterical. Amy Smart was hilarious when first introduced and Christopher Lloyd reminded me of his character in the Back to The Future movies.

If you need to see a thought provoking non-stop fun movie then please hop in your car and take the road less traveled down Interstate 60.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31453,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-09-10","keywords":"road trip,alternate reality,magic 8 ball,road movie,time warp","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Teaser Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3079324441","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjg3NjM3NDEtMzJiMi00MTgxLTk0ZTEtNDc4OTU5N2M0ODkyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjg3NjM3NDEtMzJiMi00MTgxLTk0ZTEtNDc4OTU5N2M0ODkyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg","description":"Neal Oliver, a very confused young man and an artist, takes a journey of a lifetime on a highway I60 that doesn't exist on any of the maps, going to the places he never even heard of, searching for an answer and his dreamgirl."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005188/","name":"James Marsden"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000198/","name":"Gary Oldman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000621/","name":"Kurt Russell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0301826/","name":"Bob Gale"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022335/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040305/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0039180/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0301826/","name":"Bob Gale"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Heist
Skok
Heist
programme.desc:
Heist: Directed by David Mamet. With Gene Hackman, Danny DeVito, Delroy Lindo, Sam Rockwell. A career jewel thief finds himself at tense odds with his longtime partner, a crime boss who sends his nephew to keep watch." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0252503/","name":"Heist","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDBiNTNlZTMtZjlmNC00ZGI0LWI2YjctODA4MzNlYjEyNzQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDk3NzU2MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A career jewel thief finds himself at tense odds with his longtime partner, a crime boss who sends his nephew to keep watch.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0252503/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"RowdyHagg"},"dateCreated":"2001-11-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Tries too hard","reviewBody":"Knowing the quality of Mamet's previous works, maybe I expected too much out of this one, but as it stands I just wasn't impressed by this film. Am I the only one who got bored during this movie? The characters were good except Fran (Rebecca Pidgeon). She is just there to deliver one-liners the whole time and provide sex appeal. I know her demeanor is quiet and conniving, but she just struts around waiting to make overly witty replies. The rest of the cast were excellent, Delroy Lindo outshined Hackman as his right-hand thug, Ricky Jay pulls off the calm and collected badass, Sam Rockwell delivers a good presence that you just hate, DeVito was awesome as the break-your-balls "bad" criminal and Hackman played his part well as he always does.

 The story bored me however. You knew what was going to happen before it happened and there were too many twists in the movie that they lost their affect. Twists are good when used sparingly and when used at the right time. I didn't like the timing of them in this movie or the overuse of them. It got boring because the characters always pull something out of their hat when you "least expect it."

 For me dialogue has to be two things, witty and believable. Now the dialogue in this film is witty, Mamet probably took a while to compile all these quotes into one movie, but it is too much. It is simply to much. All Rebecca Pidgeon says is these crafty responses and she engages no real conversation. As for believable, people don't speak like this. No one, not even the coolest cat in the world and half the time I am trying to figure out what the hell they mean.

 The plot is way too contrived, it is too much. Their is a backup plan, for a backup plan, for a backup plan, for a ... The scene on the runway was crap, impossible. Never would have happened. Too many "overly" perfect plans and too many twists make this plot boring to watch.

 Wait for the rental.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":35130,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-10-09","keywords":"heist,heist movie,time bomb,gang,robbery","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Heist (2001)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi447545625","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWM5MTA5YmMtNzU0OS00ZTAyLTgyMTktYTg3YmIzNjg2MDQ5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWM5MTA5YmMtNzU0OS00ZTAyLTgyMTktYTg3YmIzNjg2MDQ5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000432/","name":"Gene Hackman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0682071/","name":"Rebecca Pidgeon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000362/","name":"Danny DeVito"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000519/","name":"David Mamet"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043393/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036309/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000519/","name":"David Mamet"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Condemned
Potępiony
The Condemned
programme.desc:
The Condemned: Directed by Scott Wiper. With Steve Austin, Vinnie Jones, Robert Mammone, Tory Mussett. Jack Conrad is awaiting the death penalty in a corrupt Central American prison. He is "purchased" by a wealthy television producer and taken to a desolate island where he must fight to the death against nine other condemned killers from all corners of the world, with freedom going to the sole survivor." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0443473/","name":"The Condemned","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzkyOTczMjU0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDExMzM0MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jack Conrad is awaiting the death penalty in a corrupt Central American prison. He is "purchased" by a wealthy television producer and taken to a desolate island where he must fight to the death against nine other condemned killers f","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0443473/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rawiri42"},"dateCreated":"2013-03-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Did some people miss the clue?","reviewBody":"There are lots of pretty negative reviews of this movie and one has to wonder why those people watched it in the first place. Did they miss the essential clue as to what they would get? The opening credits clearly tell everyone that this a WWE movie. It would seem, therefore, that those who don't like the fake, meticulously staged regular offerings of World Wrestling Entertainment wouldn't want to watch this either. That isn't rocket science - is it?

But no, the wowsers and wet-nellies just HAD to watch it anyway - and then grumble and whinge about gratuitous violence and sadism. If they don't like professional wrestling, then there's a pretty sure chance they're not going to like The Condemned so why did they watch it at all? Mind you, I wouldn't mind betting that, if the story were ever true, those wowsers and wet-nellies would be among the first to sign up to watch the programme on the Internet - and then still complain! It's a bit like the well-known fact that the most vociferous anti-porn campaigners also happen to own the biggest collections of porn! (Of course it's all kept as "proof" of just how corrupted the world is - or so they say!)

OK, getting to this movie for what it is. It is a B-grade action flick with mostly B-grade actors (although there ar a few exceptions to that). Personally, I thought the story concept was quite good. The real protagonist is an entrepreneurial guy who knows that an awful lot of people actually do like gratuitous violence (he probably did research on how many viewers professional wrestling gets) and decides to convert that into a reality show. The problem is that no self-respecting TV network would ever run it and so he resorts to the obvious and puts it, live streaming on the Internet.

Without wanting to introduce any spoilers, I will stick to what the film's own promos state, which is that ten convicted criminals from death-rows around the world (another clever ploy to ensure that the maximum audience can be secured to support "their" champion) are let loose on an island which is rigged with numerous cameras and told that they must each defend themselves against the other nine as only one of them can ultimately survive. The survivor will be freed with a new identity and a big wad of money to go and do whatever he likes. There are a few little "twists" thrown in for good measure and I'll leave those who want to watch it to find out what they are. I found that I was placing myself into the shoes of each of the criminals and wondering how I could make the best of the situation. Of course, the first thing I had to do was remember that I was already sentenced to death and then view the situation from that standpoint. Secondly, I had to remember that my opponents were also killers and thus there was no room for compassion on either their parts or mine.

With that frame-of-mind established, I found myself entering into the story with a different attitude than I would have had it been presented differently. I was reminded of "Running Man" as far as the plot went but the difference was that this movie is set in the present and, as such, was (with some imagination) "believable."

OK, 'nuff said. If you don't mind action with lots of violence, then you will probably enjoy The Condemned. If you like Mary Poppins and romances, then don't watch this movie. Simple really!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":51401,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2007-04-27","keywords":"island,last man standing,website,jungle,tied feet","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Condemned (2007)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4169335321","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmE2Mzk5MDYtMDM0Mi00Y2E0LWJhMzMtNzJmYTE3OTc4ZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmE2Mzk5MDYtMDM0Mi00Y2E0LWJhMzMtNzJmYTE3OTc4ZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for this film about a deadly game show"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0042524/","name":"Steve Austin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005068/","name":"Vinnie Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0428923/","name":"Nathan Jones"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0007045/","name":"Scott Wiper"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0242604/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0135725/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0007045/","name":"Scott Wiper"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0373154/","name":"Rob Hedden"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0373151/","name":"Andy Hedden"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

He is "purchased" by a wealthy television producer and taken to a desolate island where he must fight to the death against nine other condemned killers f","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0443473/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"rawiri42","dateCreated":"2013-03-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Did some people miss the clue?","reviewBody":"There are lots of pretty negative reviews of this movie and one has to wonder why those people watched it in the first place. Did they miss the essential clue as to what they would get? The opening credits clearly tell everyone that this a WWE movie. It would seem, therefore, that those who don't like the fake, meticulously staged regular offerings of World Wrestling Entertainment wouldn't want to watch this either. That isn't rocket science - is it?

But no, the wowsers and wet-nellies just HAD to watch it anyway - and then grumble and whinge about gratuitous violence and sadism. If they don't like professional wrestling, then there's a pretty sure chance they're not going to like The Condemned so why did they watch it at all? Mind you, I wouldn't mind betting that, if the story were ever true, those wowsers and wet-nellies would be among the first to sign up to watch the programme on the Internet - and then still complain! It's a bit like the well-known fact that the most vociferous anti-porn campaigners also happen to own the biggest collections of porn! (Of course it's all kept as "proof" of just how corrupted the world is - or so they say!)

OK, getting to this movie for what it is. It is a B-grade action flick with mostly B-grade actors (although there ar a few exceptions to that). Personally, I thought the story concept was quite good. The real protagonist is an entrepreneurial guy who knows that an awful lot of people actually do like gratuitous violence (he probably did research on how many viewers professional wrestling gets) and decides to convert that into a reality show. The problem is that no self-respecting TV network would ever run it and so he resorts to the obvious and puts it, live streaming on the Internet.

Without wanting to introduce any spoilers, I will stick to what the film's own promos state, which is that ten convicted criminals from death-rows around the world (another clever ploy to ensure that the maximum audience can be secured to support "their" champion) are let loose on an island which is rigged with numerous cameras and told that they must each defend themselves against the other nine as only one of them can ultimately survive. The survivor will be freed with a new identity and a big wad of money to go and do whatever he likes. There are a few little "twists" thrown in for good measure and I'll leave those who want to watch it to find out what they are. I found that I was placing myself into the shoes of each of the criminals and wondering how I could make the best of the situation. Of course, the first thing I had to do was remember that I was already sentenced to death and then view the situation from that standpoint. Secondly, I had to remember that my opponents were also killers and thus there was no room for compassion on either their parts or mine.

With that frame-of-mind established, I found myself entering into the story with a different attitude than I would have had it been presented differently. I was reminded of "Running Man" as far as the plot went but the difference was that this movie is set in the present and, as such, was (with some imagination) "believable."

OK, 'nuff said. If you don't mind action with lots of violence, then you will probably enjoy The Condemned. If you like Mary Poppins and romances, then don't watch this movie.
