Eternal Beauty
programme.desc: Eternal Beauty: Directed by Craig Roberts. With Sally Hawkins, Morfydd Clark, Robert Pugh, Natalie O'Neill. After Jane falls into a state of despair over her schizophrenia, she encounters new sources of love and life with surprising results." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5362940/","name":"Eternal Beauty","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWE3ZmZhOTctOTU5Ny00MTM0LWFkZjctYjc0OWI1ZjM3MzQ5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"After Jane falls into a state of despair over her schizophrenia, she encounters new sources of love and life with surprising results.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5362940/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"steveo122"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"excruciating","reviewBody":"I curse the sadistic bstrds who conned me into watching what I rigorously avoid seeing by casting Sally Hawkins. My first thought was about the appropriateness of a mentally unbalanced protagonist these days. But it's SallyfckngHawkins and she gives an exquisite performance of palpable human turmoil that causes emotional empathy - they might as well have filmed a wounded baby bird struggling to stumble its way across a busy sidewalk toward unseen cats - excruciating. Everyone is very good, even the vile ones...the plot, script and direction are noticeably stylized and always interesting.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1618,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-10-02","keywords":"psychiatric hospital,three sisters,overbearing mother,hearing voices,psychosis","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1868414489","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmVjYjhhM2MtYjc0NC00N2UzLTg0ZDQtYjU3MzE0NjIzYTY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmVjYjhhM2MtYjc0NC00N2UzLTg0ZDQtYjU3MzE0NjIzYTY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"After Jane (Sally Hawkins) falls into a state of despair over her schizophrenia, she encounters new sources of love and life with surprising results."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1020089/","name":"Sally Hawkins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6077056/","name":"Morfydd Clark"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0700059/","name":"Robert Pugh"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1064292/","name":"Craig Roberts"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0607578/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037450/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0670857/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1064292/","name":"Craig Roberts"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Man with the Golden Gun
Człowiek ze złotym pistoletem
The Man with the Golden Gun
programme.desc:
The Man with the Golden Gun: Directed by Guy Hamilton. With Roger Moore, Christopher Lee, Britt Ekland, Maud Adams. James Bond is targeted by the world's most expensive assassin, while he attempts to recover sensitive solar cell technology that is being sold to the highest bidder." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0071807/","name":"The Man with the Golden Gun","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjY3YmM1MTItMWE0NC00NjFmLWFkMDgtMWFiZjY5NzQyZGVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"James Bond is targeted by the world's most expensive assassin, while he attempts to recover sensitive solar cell technology that is being sold to the highest bidder.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0071807/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"uroshnor54"},"dateCreated":"2014-07-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretty Good","reviewBody":"The Man with the Golden Gun wasn't a bad movie. I actually thought it was better than Ian Fleming's novel (quite a few of the movies adapted from his books are better than them, in my opinion). I thought it started out pretty well but it did kind of lose steam by the end in my opinion.

I liked Christopher Lee and Maud Adams. Roger Moore's my favorite Bond but I didn't like him here as much as in just about all his other movies. Britt Ekland was okay but not great. And I'm usually easily pleased by most Bond girls (I actually liked Tanya Roberts's character in A View to a Kill).

The climax was pretty disappointing. The fight between Bond and Scaramanga should have gone on longer. The flying car was kind of dumb. And I thought it was kind of pointless to have Sheriff J.W. Pepper in this movie. And I was kind of hoping he'd meet that kid somehow and give him the 20,000 bahts (it is a Roger Moore Bond movie, after all, so it's not like it would have been an unbelievable coincidence).

Overall, it wasn't wonderful but not that bad either.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":101467,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1974-12-20","keywords":"secret agent,official james bond series,assassin,mission,female martial artist","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2754854681","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FkOGI3NTMtMWQ3Ny00ZjIyLWE1NzYtZDYyZjE2NDc3MDQ5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FkOGI3NTMtMWQ3Ny00ZjIyLWE1NzYtZDYyZjE2NDc3MDQ5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000549/","name":"Roger Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000489/","name":"Christopher Lee"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001180/","name":"Britt Ekland"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0357891/","name":"Guy Hamilton"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0537363/","name":"Richard Maibaum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0542539/","name":"Tom Mankiewicz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001220/","name":"Ian Fleming"}],"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

I actually thought it was better than Ian Fleming's novel (quite a few of the movies adapted from his books are better than them, in my opinion). I thought it started out pretty well but it did kind of lose steam by the end in my opinion.

I liked Christopher Lee and Maud Adams. Roger Moore's my favorite Bond but I didn't like him here as much as in just about all his other movies. Britt Ekland was okay but not great. And I'm usually easily pleased by most Bond girls (I actually liked Tanya Roberts's character in A View to a Kill).

The climax was pretty disappointing. The fight between Bond and Scaramanga should have gone on longer. The flying car was kind of dumb. And I thought it was kind of pointless to have Sheriff J.W. Pepper in this movie. And I was kind of hoping he'd meet that kid somehow and give him the 20,000 bahts (it is a Roger Moore Bond movie, after all, so it's not like it would have been an unbelievable coincidence).

programme.title: The Spy Who Loved Me
Szpieg, który mnie kochał
The Spy Who Loved Me
programme.desc: The Spy Who Loved Me: Directed by Lewis Gilbert. With Roger Moore, Barbara Bach, Curd Jürgens, Richard Kiel. James Bond investigates the hijacking of British and Russian submarines carrying nuclear warheads, with the help of a K.G.B. agent whose lover he killed." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0076752/","name":"The Spy Who Loved Me","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDJhOTgyMTUtMDVhOS00MzRlLTk0MjYtYjI5NzhhMTExMTc1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDY2MTk1ODk@._V1_.jpg","description":"James Bond investigates the hijacking of British and Russian submarines carrying nuclear warheads, with the help of a K.G.B. agent whose lover he killed.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0076752/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"J. Spurlin"},"dateCreated":"2010-08-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fabulous nonsense, superior to all the previous Roger Moore Bonds, with an unforgettable villain","reviewBody":"James Bond (Roger Moore) teams with a sexy Russian agent (Barbara Bach) to stop a web-fingered megalomaniac (Curd Jürgens) from destroying the world and rebuilding it as a new Atlantis.\n\n"The Spy Who Loved Me" is fabulous nonsense, superior to all the previous Roger Moore Bonds, even with the obvious model shots, process shots and the occasionally corny background music by Marvin Hamlisch, who also wrote the music for the theme song, "Nobody Does It Better." (It's popular, but you can have it.) The gadgets, sets, stunts and one-liners are more outrageous than ever. Jürgens makes a good villain, and so does the shark he unleashes on traitors; but the bad guy everyone remembers is Jaws—not another shark, but a metal-mouthed giant played by Richard Kiel. He is Jürgens's best henchman—not good enough to outmatch Bond, but enough to survive for the next Bond adventure."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":104467,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1977-07-08","keywords":"official james bond series,jaws,007,british secret service,russian spy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Spy Who Loved Me","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1285883161","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjBmMjFjZmItM2VhNC00NjgzLTlmYzMtMDhjYTc3MDYxODU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjBmMjFjZmItM2VhNC00NjgzLTlmYzMtMDhjYTc3MDYxODU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000549/","name":"Roger Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000819/","name":"Barbara Bach"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0432007/","name":"Curd Jürgens"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0318150/","name":"Lewis Gilbert"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228970/","name":"Christopher Wood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0537363/","name":"Richard Maibaum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001220/","name":"Ian Fleming"}],"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Star Trek Beyond
Star Trek: W nieznane
Star Trek Beyond
programme.desc:
Star Trek Beyond: Directed by Justin Lin. With Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto, Karl Urban, Zoe Saldana. The crew of the USS Enterprise explores the furthest reaches of uncharted space, where they encounter a new ruthless enemy, who puts them, and everything the Federation stands for, to the test." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2660888/","name":"Star Trek Beyond","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODgzMTZmMGMtNTM4Ni00ZjIxLWIyYmUtZjcxMDEwMjkxMzQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjMwNDgzNjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"The crew of the USS Enterprise explores the furthest reaches of uncharted space, where they encounter a new ruthless enemy, who puts them, and everything the Federation stands for, to the test.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2660888/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"avi-goldberi"},"dateCreated":"2020-11-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Hollywood Taken Over By Hokey Hacks","reviewBody":"Just give it up.

And shame on the studio and producers who hand projects to these 'directors' and 'writers'

But whose fault is it? It is our fault for watching.

We watch movies where aliens rap to hip hop. We watch movies where aliens from the future think a motorcycle from 20th century is revving fun. We watch movies where aliens from the future think boom boxes are neat. We watch movies where a human is impacted by an explosion, lifted up into the air, lands a parsec away and he gets up and continues to run."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":238122,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2016-07-21","keywords":"star trek,third part,alien,stranded,sequel","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Final Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi354465561","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMyODk2NzY5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjI1Mjc0OTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMyODk2NzY5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjI1Mjc0OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The USS Enterprise crew explores the furthest reaches of uncharted space, where they encounter a new ruthless enemy who puts them and everything the Federation stands for to the test."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1517976/","name":"Chris Pine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0704270/","name":"Zachary Quinto"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0881631/","name":"Karl Urban"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510912/","name":"Justin Lin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0152219/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0708328/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0670408/","name":"Simon Pegg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1136647/","name":"Doug Jung"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0734472/","name":"Gene Roddenberry"}],"duration":"PT2H2M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Be Water
Głębia strachu
Underwater
programme.desc: Be Water: Directed by Bao Nguyen. With Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, Linda Lee Cadwell, Dan Inosanto, Diana Lee Inosanto. Rejected by Hollywood, Bruce Lee returned to Hong Kong to complete four films. Charting his struggles in two worlds, Be Water explores questions of identity and representation through rare archive, intimate interviews, and his writings." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11394168/","name":"Be Water","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjNhNzY3N2UtZjIwYi00NDEyLTlmMzMtZGI3ZGUwZTM1MWY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Rejected by Hollywood, Bruce Lee returned to Hong Kong to complete four films. Charting his struggles in two worlds, Be Water explores questions of identity and representation through rare archive, intimate interviews, and his writin","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11394168/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eliotar6998"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Hero Worth Idolizing","reviewBody":"The inspirational value of Bruce Lee is best expressed by his response to the question of whether he thought of himself as Chinese or American. "You know what I want to think of myself," he said, "as a human being." Bruce Lee was a man who spent his entire life building bridges; between styles of martial arts, between cultures at odds with one another, and between inner and external philosophies. He felt that true strength comes from within, and that by recognizing that strength, as well as all the flaws that coexist alongside it, one can achieve greatness despite all odds. Bruce Lee is a hero worth idolizing because he did not see himself as one. He did not view himself as a star, or a saint. He was true to himself, accepting the good with the bad. He was confident, but not conceited, wise, but not condescending. He was a man who fought for all he achieved, and deserved every ounce of his success.\n\nIt is essential, given the current climate of racial injustice in the United States, that a documentary about a man who played such a role in dismantling prejudice against Asian-Americans take all the racial factors involved into full consideration and treat them respectfully and knowledgeably, and this documentary does exactly that. It is about Bruce Lee, yes, but more importantly it is about the struggle that he and so many Asian-Americans face even today. It is a story of a man who was able to raise himself above it all, against all odds, and prove to the world that an Asian man could outshine any leading actor, and that by virtue of his determination was equally if not more deserving of the superstardom so often relegated to the white Hollywood elite.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1386,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2020-06-07","keywords":"bruce lee","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"First Look Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2435890713","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGEzN2Q0YWEtNjIyNi00YTMxLTlmN2UtYTFkY2M0YTc4YmE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGEzN2Q0YWEtNjIyNi00YTMxLTlmN2UtYTFkY2M0YTc4YmE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Take a first look at 'Be Water,' a 30 for 30 film that intimately chronicles Bruce Lee's life and complex journey, which premieres on Sunday, June 7th at 9pm ET on ESPN"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000717/","name":"Kareem Abdul-Jabbar"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004791/","name":"Linda Lee Cadwell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0409261/","name":"Dan Inosanto"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3686143/","name":"Bao Nguyen"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Moonraker
Moonraker
programme.desc:
Moonraker: Directed by Lewis Gilbert. With Roger Moore, Lois Chiles, Michael Lonsdale, Richard Kiel. James Bond investigates the mid-air theft of a space shuttle, and discovers a plot to commit global genocide." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0079574/","name":"Moonraker","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2M5MTA3YzUtZDRiNi00NTk4LTk2ODEtY2ZiOTZmMzcwNjQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDY2MTk1ODk@._V1_.jpg","description":"James Bond investigates the mid-air theft of a space shuttle, and discovers a plot to commit global genocide.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0079574/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ma-cortes"},"dateCreated":"2010-11-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Likable Roger Moore in an amazing adventure set on exterior space","reviewBody":"Roger Moore's entry in which faces dangerous adventures around the world . Moore's outing with overwhelming action and spectacular scenarios , the film teams Bond with an American agent (gorgeous Lois Chiles) in an effort to stop an industrialist from destroying the surface world so he can rule an outland kingdom . After his first introduction in ¨Live and let die¨ as tough and attractive James Bond of the Ian Fleming's famous creation , Roger Moore went on playing various 007 , and ¨Moonraker¨ is one of the best . The picture starts with an overblown free-fall opening , the best part of this film and introducing a giant villain (Richard Kiel who will repeat in subsequent entry). This Bond film deals about seductive James Bond OO7 as the ultimate spy hero who is assigned by MI6 a dangerous mission pursuing an intergalactic mad man (Michael Lonsdale in a potentially sinister presence as the head baddie) . Meanwhile , Bond goes to Venice there happens a high-octane race and Bond discovers clues in Rio De Janeiro. James is double-crossed and continues to follow the lead , deciding to investigate in Amazonas . Following the tracks all lead a nasty billionaire , a maniacal villain who schemes a world conspiracy.

Roger Moore as James Bond is cool , he does remarkably well , he earns in irony, suavity and sympathy, however also has coldness ,cunning , intelligence and toughness . Here Bond is an efficient , relentless agent trying to chase obstinately the criminals , traveling around the world as always , as this globe-trotting story is set in England ,America, Venice, Amazonas , Rio De Janeiro and exterior space . Bond to achieve his aims , along the way uses violent means even pulling off brutal killings against enemies who wreak all sorts of havoc . As always Bond will use gadgets provided by ¨Q¨ (Desmond Llewelyn) . In addition , there appears the usual as Lois Maxwell, ¨MoneyPenny¨ , Sir Gray as Geoffrey Keen , Walter Goetell as Russian general and Bernard Lee's last appearance as ¨M¨ .

The picture contains comic-strip adventure , sensational pursuits , silly set pieces, great stunts, tongue-in check humor, frantic action packed , amazing gimmicks and stimulating images like are the happenings on the spectacular races, the breathtaking aerial scenes, and the spacial fights . As is like a roller-coaster , as is fast-paced, light, excitement, funny and entertaining ; it's a winner for oo7 fans and non-fans alike . The chase and suspense formula wears strong in this entry .Enjoyable title song by Shirley Bassey and stirring musical score fitting to action by the usual composer, the classic John Barry . Riveting and fancy main titles by habitual Maurice Binder , furthermore eye-popping production design by Ken Adam . It's brimming with colorful and fascinating cinematography by cameraman Jean Tournier. The motion picture produced by habitual producers, Albert R Broccoli and Michael G. Wilson , being professionally directed by Lewis Gilbert who directed various outings though with no originality . Director Gilbert keeps this moving at an incredibly fast pace and this story about every's favorite super-spy falling in love with a CIA agent is one of author Ian Fleming's best . The film will appeal to James Bond series's buffs but good for fans only ; because this one goes on far too long . Rating : 6'5 , well worth watching .","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":96818,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1979-06-27","keywords":"bad guy turns good,space shuttle,space station,astronaut,official james bond series","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000549/","name":"Roger Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001042/","name":"Lois Chiles"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003909/","name":"Michael Lonsdale"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0318150/","name":"Lewis Gilbert"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026336/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228970/","name":"Christopher Wood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001220/","name":"Ian Fleming"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0026755/","name":"Gerry Anderson"}],"duration":"PT2H6M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: For Your Eyes Only
Tylko dla twoich oczu
For Your Eyes Only
programme.desc:
For Your Eyes Only: Directed by John Glen. With Roger Moore, Carole Bouquet, Topol, Lynn-Holly Johnson. James Bond is assigned to find a missing British vessel, equipped with a weapons encryption device and prevent it from falling into enemy hands." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0082398/","name":"For Your Eyes Only","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzQ4YzUzNGQtMDNkYS00NTk5LTkyMDgtNmVkMjg5MjIzNTdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDY2MTk1ODk@._V1_.jpg","description":"James Bond is assigned to find a missing British vessel, equipped with a weapons encryption device and prevent it from falling into enemy hands.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0082398/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ma-cortes"},"dateCreated":"2010-12-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"High adventure and marvelous underwater scenes by debuting filmmaker John Glenn","reviewBody":"Likable Roger Moore in an amazing adventure set on wonderful outdoors located mostly on Greece and Greek islands . This is a Bond's good entry in which faces dangerous adventures around the world . Moore's outing with overwhelming action and spectacular scenarios , the film teams Bond with an archaeologist as endearing ally ( a beautiful Carole Bouquet) in an effort to stop an industrialist from selling a mechanical artifact . After his first introduction in ¨Live and let die¨ as tough and attractive James Bond of the Ian Fleming's famous creation , Roger Moore went on playing various 007 , and ¨ For your eyes only ¨ is one of the best . The picture starts with an overblown opening , the best part of this film in which James Bond reckoning to Blofield (in previous entries played by Donald Plesance and Charles Gray , but here doesn't appear his face) . This thrilling film deals about seductive James Bond as the ultimate spy hero who is assigned by MI6 a dangerous mission to recover an important device that control over British Polaris nuclear subs . As Bond joins the search, he suspects the tough Colombo (Topol as a gregarious smuggler) and the suave Kristatos (Julian Glover) of seizing the powerful system. Bond finds an ally in the gorgeous Melina Havelock (Carol Bouquet) , who blames Colombo for the death of her parents (Jack Hedley) . Meanwhile , Bond goes to a ski station , there happens a high-octane race and Bond discovers some clues and confronting hoodlums (Michael Gothard ,Charles Dance). James is double-crossed and continues to follow the lead , deciding to investigate on the Egean sea . Following the tracks all lead a nasty billionaire , a maniacal villain who schemes the selling of the powerful machine to a Russian general (Walter Goetell).

This solid , slick thriller with magic mix of action-packed , dazzling stunts, gadgetry, and romance provided by sexy company as Carol Bouquet, Lynn Holly Johnson and Cassandra Harris (first wife of Pierce Brosnan until her death) . Roger Moore as James Bond is fine , he does remarkably well , he earns in irony, humor ,suavity and sympathy, however also has coldness ,cunning , intelligence and toughness . Here Bond is an efficient , relentless agent trying to chase obstinately the criminals , traveling around the world as always , as this globe-trotting story is set in Spain , Veneto ,Italia and Greece at Meteoro mountains and Corfu islands . Bond to achieve his aims , along the way uses violent means even pulling off brutal killings against enemies who wreak all sorts of havoc . As always Bond will use fantastic gadgets and spectacular cars (here a Lotus) provided by ¨Q¨ (Desmond Llewelyn) . In addition , there appears the usual as Lois Maxwell, ¨MoneyPenny¨ , Minister of Defense as Geoffrey Keen and Walter Goetell as Russian general .

The picture contains comic-strip adventure , sensational pursuits , silly set pieces, great stunts, tongue-in check humor, automovile chase, frantic unstopped action , an impressive tour over razor-sharp coral reefs, amazing gimmicks and stimulating images like are the happenings on the spectacular pursuits on the snow, the overwhelming underwater scenes, and the breathtaking battles . As is like a roller-coaster , as is fast-paced, light, excitement, funny and entertaining ; it's a winner for oo7 fans and non-fans alike . The chase and suspense formula wears strong in this entry .The action-packed includes , exciting underwater fights, and cliffhanging assault of a rousing mountaintop fortress filmed in Meteoro monastery .Enjoyable title song by Sheena Easton and stirring musical score fitting to action by Bill Conti (Rocky saga's composer) ,following the John Barry's classic style . Riveting and fancy main titles by habitual Maurice Binder , furthermore eye-popping production design by Peter Lamont. It's brimming with colorful and fascinating cinematography by cameraman Alan Hume . The motion picture produced by habitual producers, Albert R Broccoli and Michael G. Wilson , being professionally made by John Glenn who filmed various outings and previously directed 2nd unit and edition on some early Bond movies . He directed several entries as ¨Licence to kill, A view to kill , For your eyes only and Octopussy¨ though with no much originality . Debuting John Glenn keeps this moving at an incredibly fast pace and this story about every's favorite super-spy falling in love with an archaeologist is one of author Ian Fleming's best . The film will appeal to James Bond series's buffs but good for fans only ; because this one goes on far too long and has provoked so much debate among 007 followers . Rating : 6'5 , well worth watching .","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":97463,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1981-06-25","keywords":"cortina italy,007,albania,blofeld's cat,official bond film","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"For Your Eyes Only","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi123601433","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM3ZGZiMzctNjNhZC00YWVmLTkyZWYtNmM2MTUxZTg1YTYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM3ZGZiMzctNjNhZC00YWVmLTkyZWYtNmM2MTUxZTg1YTYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for this James Bond classic"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000549/","name":"Roger Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000962/","name":"Carole Bouquet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0867694/","name":"Topol"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322515/","name":"John Glen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0537363/","name":"Richard Maibaum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933865/","name":"Michael G. He directed several entries as ¨Licence to kill, A view to kill , For your eyes only and Octopussy¨ though with no much originality . Debuting John Glenn keeps this moving at an incredibly fast pace and this story about every's favorite super-spy falling in love with an archaeologist is one of author Ian Fleming's best . The film will appeal to James Bond series's buffs but good for fans only ; because this one goes on far too long and has provoked so much debate among 007 followers . Rating : 6'5 , well worth watching .","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":97463,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1981-06-25","keywords":"cortina italy,007,albania,blofeld's cat,official bond film","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"For Your Eyes Only","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi123601433","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM3ZGZiMzctNjNhZC00YWVmLTkyZWYtNmM2MTUxZTg1YTYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM3ZGZiMzctNjNhZC00YWVmLTkyZWYtNmM2MTUxZTg1YTYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for this James Bond classic","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000549/","name":"Roger Moore","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000962/","name":"Carole Bouquet","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0867694/","name":"Topol"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322515/","name":"John Glen"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0537363/","name":"Richard Maibaum","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933865/","name":"Michael G. programme.title: Be Water
Głębia strachu
Underwater
programme.desc: Be Water: Directed by Bao Nguyen. With Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, Linda Lee Cadwell, Dan Inosanto, Diana Lee Inosanto. Rejected by Hollywood, Bruce Lee returned to Hong Kong to complete four films. Charting his struggles in two worlds, Be Water explores questions of identity and representation through rare archive, intimate interviews, and his writings." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11394168/","name":"Be Water","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjNhNzY3N2UtZjIwYi00NDEyLTlmMzMtZGI3ZGUwZTM1MWY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Rejected by Hollywood, Bruce Lee returned to Hong Kong to complete four films. Charting his struggles in two worlds, Be Water explores questions of identity and representation through rare archive, intimate interviews, and his writin","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11394168/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"eliotar6998"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Hero Worth Idolizing","reviewBody":"The inspirational value of Bruce Lee is best expressed by his response to the question of whether he thought of himself as Chinese or American. "You know what I want to think of myself," he said, "as a human being." Bruce Lee was a man who spent his entire life building bridges; between styles of martial arts, between cultures at odds with one another, and between inner and external philosophies. He felt that true strength comes from within, and that by recognizing that strength, as well as all the flaws that coexist alongside it, one can achieve greatness despite all odds. Bruce Lee is a hero worth idolizing because he did not see himself as one. He did not view himself as a star, or a saint. He was true to himself, accepting the good with the bad. He was confident, but not conceited, wise, but not condescending. He was a man who fought for all he achieved, and deserved every ounce of his success.\n\nIt is essential, given the current climate of racial injustice in the United States, that a documentary about a man who played such a role in dismantling prejudice against Asian-Americans take all the racial factors involved into full consideration and treat them respectfully and knowledgeably, and this documentary does exactly that. It is about Bruce Lee, yes, but more importantly it is about the struggle that he and so many Asian-Americans face even today. It is a story of a man who was able to raise himself above it all, against all odds, and prove to the world that an Asian man could outshine any leading actor, and that by virtue of his determination was equally if not more deserving of the superstardom so often relegated to the white Hollywood elite.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1386,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2020-06-07","keywords":"bruce lee","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"First Look Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2435890713","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGEzN2Q0YWEtNjIyNi00YTMxLTlmN2UtYTFkY2M0YTc4YmE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGEzN2Q0YWEtNjIyNi00YTMxLTlmN2UtYTFkY2M0YTc4YmE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Take a first look at 'Be Water,' a 30 for 30 film that intimately chronicles Bruce Lee's life and complex journey, which premieres on Sunday, June 7th at 9pm ET on ESPN"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000717/","name":"Kareem Abdul-Jabbar"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004791/","name":"Linda Lee Cadwell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0409261/","name":"Dan Inosanto"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3686143/","name":"Bao Nguyen"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Star Trek Beyond
Star Trek: W nieznane
Star Trek Beyond
programme.desc:
Star Trek Beyond: Directed by Justin Lin. With Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto, Karl Urban, Zoe Saldana. The crew of the USS Enterprise explores the furthest reaches of uncharted space, where they encounter a new ruthless enemy, who puts them, and everything the Federation stands for, to the test." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2660888/","name":"Star Trek Beyond","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODgzMTZmMGMtNTM4Ni00ZjIxLWIyYmUtZjcxMDEwMjkxMzQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjMwNDgzNjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"The crew of the USS Enterprise explores the furthest reaches of uncharted space, where they encounter a new ruthless enemy, who puts them, and everything the Federation stands for, to the test.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2660888/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"avi-goldberi"},"dateCreated":"2020-11-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Hollywood Taken Over By Hokey Hacks","reviewBody":"Just give it up.

And shame on the studio and producers who hand projects to these 'directors' and 'writers'

But whose fault is it? It is our fault for watching.

We watch movies where aliens rap to hip hop. We watch movies where aliens from the future think a motorcycle from 20th century is revving fun. We watch movies where aliens from the future think boom boxes are neat. We watch movies where a human is impacted by an explosion, lifted up into the air, lands a parsec away and he gets up and continues to run."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":238122,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2016-07-21","keywords":"star trek,third part,alien,stranded,sequel","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Final Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi354465561","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMyODk2NzY5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjI1Mjc0OTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMyODk2NzY5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjI1Mjc0OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The USS Enterprise crew explores the furthest reaches of uncharted space, where they encounter a new ruthless enemy who puts them and everything the Federation stands for to the test."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1517976/","name":"Chris Pine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0704270/","name":"Zachary Quinto"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0881631/","name":"Karl Urban"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510912/","name":"Justin Lin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0152219/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0708328/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0670408/","name":"Simon Pegg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1136647/","name":"Doug Jung"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0734472/","name":"Gene Roddenberry"}],"duration":"PT2H2M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Nocturnal Animals
Zwierzęta nocy
Nocturnal Animals
programme.desc:
Nocturnal Animals: Directed by Tom Ford. With Amy Adams, Jake Gyllenhaal, Michael Shannon, Aaron Taylor-Johnson. A wealthy art gallery owner is haunted by her ex-husband's novel, a violent thriller she interprets as a symbolic revenge tale." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4550098/","name":"Nocturnal Animals","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMzMwMzgxNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTA0MTUzMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A wealthy art gallery owner is haunted by her ex-husband's novel, a violent thriller she interprets as a symbolic revenge tale.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4550098/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"slimecity-38663"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Thats great acting Gary!","reviewBody":"On a bit of a Jake binge, that led me here. You also cant go wrong with Amy Adams. Plus Jenna Malone if you are a fan of the amazing Neon Demon.

The story revolves around a novel containing a fairly OTT crime, but one that leaves room for visually compelling scene-setups. I like how the novel unfolds over several years, and ties in with the regrets over the decisions that the Amy Adams character made over her life. The analogies between her loveless, vacuous and empty life and the novel are pretty apparent.

This is a very compelling film with a very haunting ending. Well worth a watch. Its pretty tough viewing at times though","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":256400,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2016-12-09","keywords":"revenge,loss of wife,art gallery,female frontal nudity,based on novel","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Teaser Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2326443545","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYzNzExODM2MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzQ3MDMwMDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYzNzExODM2MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzQ3MDMwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"An art gallery owner is haunted by her ex-husband's novel, a violent thriller she interprets as a veiled threat and a symbolic revenge tale."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0010736/","name":"Amy Adams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0350453/","name":"Jake Gyllenhaal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0788335/","name":"Michael Shannon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1053530/","name":"Tom Ford"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042399/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0251339/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0193161/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1053530/","name":"Tom Ford"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7216022/","name":"Austin Wright"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

Moonraker: Directed by Lewis Gilbert. With Roger Moore, Lois Chiles, Michael Lonsdale, Richard Kiel. James Bond investigates the mid-air theft of a space shuttle, and discovers a plot to commit global genocide." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0079574/","name":"Moonraker","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2M5MTA3YzUtZDRiNi00NTk4LTk2ODEtY2ZiOTZmMzcwNjQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDY2MTk1ODk@._V1_.jpg","description":"James Bond investigates the mid-air theft of a space shuttle, and discovers a plot to commit global genocide.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0079574/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ma-cortes"},"dateCreated":"2010-11-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Likable Roger Moore in an amazing adventure set on exterior space","reviewBody":"Roger Moore's entry in which faces dangerous adventures around the world . Moore's outing with overwhelming action and spectacular scenarios , the film teams Bond with an American agent (gorgeous Lois Chiles) in an effort to stop an industrialist from destroying the surface world so he can rule an outland kingdom . After his first introduction in ¨Live and let die¨ as tough and attractive James Bond of the Ian Fleming's famous creation , Roger Moore went on playing various 007 , and ¨Moonraker¨ is one of the best . The picture starts with an overblown free-fall opening , the best part of this film and introducing a giant villain (Richard Kiel who will repeat in subsequent entry). This Bond film deals about seductive James Bond OO7 as the ultimate spy hero who is assigned by MI6 a dangerous mission pursuing an intergalactic mad man (Michael Lonsdale in a potentially sinister presence as the head baddie) . Meanwhile , Bond goes to Venice there happens a high-octane race and Bond discovers clues in Rio De Janeiro. James is double-crossed and continues to follow the lead , deciding to investigate in Amazonas . Following the tracks all lead a nasty billionaire , a maniacal villain who schemes a world conspiracy.

Roger Moore as James Bond is cool , he does remarkably well , he earns in irony, suavity and sympathy, however also has coldness ,cunning , intelligence and toughness . Here Bond is an efficient , relentless agent trying to chase obstinately the criminals , traveling around the world as always , as this globe-trotting story is set in England ,America, Venice, Amazonas , Rio De Janeiro and exterior space . Bond to achieve his aims , along the way uses violent means even pulling off brutal killings against enemies who wreak all sorts of havoc . As always Bond will use gadgets provided by ¨Q¨ (Desmond Llewelyn) . In addition , there appears the usual as Lois Maxwell, ¨MoneyPenny¨ , Sir Gray as Geoffrey Keen , Walter Goetell as Russian general and Bernard Lee's last appearance as ¨M¨ .

The picture contains comic-strip adventure , sensational pursuits , silly set pieces, great stunts, tongue-in check humor, frantic action packed , amazing gimmicks and stimulating images like are the happenings on the spectacular races, the breathtaking aerial scenes, and the spacial fights . As is like a roller-coaster , as is fast-paced, light, excitement, funny and entertaining ; it's a winner for oo7 fans and non-fans alike . The chase and suspense formula wears strong in this entry .Enjoyable title song by Shirley Bassey and stirring musical score fitting to action by the usual composer, the classic John Barry . Riveting and fancy main titles by habitual Maurice Binder , furthermore eye-popping production design by Ken Adam . It's brimming with colorful and fascinating cinematography by cameraman Jean Tournier. The motion picture produced by habitual producers, Albert R Broccoli and Michael G. Wilson , being professionally directed by Lewis Gilbert who directed various outings though with no originality . Director Gilbert keeps this moving at an incredibly fast pace and this story about every's favorite super-spy falling in love with a CIA agent is one of author Ian Fleming's best . The film will appeal to James Bond series's buffs but good for fans only ; because this one goes on far too long . Rating : 6'5 , well worth watching .","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":96818,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1979-06-27","keywords":"bad guy turns good,space shuttle,space station,astronaut,official james bond series","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000549/","name":"Roger Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001042/","name":"Lois Chiles"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003909/","name":"Michael Lonsdale"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0318150/","name":"Lewis Gilbert"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026336/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228970/","name":"Christopher Wood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001220/","name":"Ian Fleming"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0026755/","name":"Gerry Anderson"}],"duration":"PT2H6M"}</script><metacontent="

For Your Eyes Only
programme.desc:
For Your Eyes Only: Directed by John Glen. With Roger Moore, Carole Bouquet, Topol, Lynn-Holly Johnson. James Bond is assigned to find a missing British vessel, equipped with a weapons encryption device and prevent it from falling into enemy hands." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0082398/","name":"For Your Eyes Only","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzQ4YzUzNGQtMDNkYS00NTk5LTkyMDgtNmVkMjg5MjIzNTdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDY2MTk1ODk@._V1_.jpg","description":"James Bond is assigned to find a missing British vessel, equipped with a weapons encryption device and prevent it from falling into enemy hands.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0082398/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ma-cortes"},"dateCreated":"2010-12-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"High adventure and marvelous underwater scenes by debuting filmmaker John Glenn","reviewBody":"Likable Roger Moore in an amazing adventure set on wonderful outdoors located mostly on Greece and Greek islands . This is a Bond's good entry in which faces dangerous adventures around the world . Moore's outing with overwhelming action and spectacular scenarios , the film teams Bond with an archaeologist as endearing ally ( a beautiful Carole Bouquet) in an effort to stop an industrialist from selling a mechanical artifact . After his first introduction in ¨Live and let die¨ as tough and attractive James Bond of the Ian Fleming's famous creation , Roger Moore went on playing various 007 , and ¨ For your eyes only ¨ is one of the best . The picture starts with an overblown opening , the best part of this film in which James Bond reckoning to Blofield (in previous entries played by Donald Plesance and Charles Gray , but here doesn't appear his face) . This thrilling film deals about seductive James Bond as the ultimate spy hero who is assigned by MI6 a dangerous mission to recover an important device that control over British Polaris nuclear subs . As Bond joins the search, he suspects the tough Colombo (Topol as a gregarious smuggler) and the suave Kristatos (Julian Glover) of seizing the powerful system. Bond finds an ally in the gorgeous Melina Havelock (Carol Bouquet) , who blames Colombo for the death of her parents (Jack Hedley) . Meanwhile , Bond goes to a ski station , there happens a high-octane race and Bond discovers some clues and confronting hoodlums (Michael Gothard ,Charles Dance). James is double-crossed and continues to follow the lead , deciding to investigate on the Egean sea . Following the tracks all lead a nasty billionaire , a maniacal villain who schemes the selling of the powerful machine to a Russian general (Walter Goetell).

This solid , slick thriller with magic mix of action-packed , dazzling stunts, gadgetry, and romance provided by sexy company as Carol Bouquet, Lynn Holly Johnson and Cassandra Harris (first wife of Pierce Brosnan until her death) . Roger Moore as James Bond is fine , he does remarkably well , he earns in irony, humor ,suavity and sympathy, however also has coldness ,cunning , intelligence and toughness . Here Bond is an efficient , relentless agent trying to chase obstinately the criminals , traveling around the world as always , as this globe-trotting story is set in Spain , Veneto ,Italia and Greece at Meteoro mountains and Corfu islands . Bond to achieve his aims , along the way uses violent means even pulling off brutal killings against enemies who wreak all sorts of havoc . As always Bond will use fantastic gadgets and spectacular cars (here a Lotus) provided by ¨Q¨ (Desmond Llewelyn) . In addition , there appears the usual as Lois Maxwell, ¨MoneyPenny¨ , Minister of Defense as Geoffrey Keen and Walter Goetell as Russian general .

The picture contains comic-strip adventure , sensational pursuits , silly set pieces, great stunts, tongue-in check humor, automovile chase, frantic unstopped action , an impressive tour over razor-sharp coral reefs, amazing gimmicks and stimulating images like are the happenings on the spectacular pursuits on the snow, the overwhelming underwater scenes, and the breathtaking battles . As is like a roller-coaster , as is fast-paced, light, excitement, funny and entertaining ; it's a winner for oo7 fans and non-fans alike . The chase and suspense formula wears strong in this entry .The action-packed includes , exciting underwater fights, and cliffhanging assault of a rousing mountaintop fortress filmed in Meteoro monastery .Enjoyable title song by Sheena Easton and stirring musical score fitting to action by Bill Conti (Rocky saga's composer) ,following the John Barry's classic style . Riveting and fancy main titles by habitual Maurice Binder , furthermore eye-popping production design by Peter Lamont. It's brimming with colorful and fascinating cinematography by cameraman Alan Hume . The motion picture produced by habitual producers, Albert R Broccoli and Michael G. Wilson , being professionally made by John Glenn who filmed various outings and previously directed 2nd unit and edition on some early Bond movies . He directed several entries as ¨Licence to kill, A view to kill , For your eyes only and Octopussy¨ though with no much originality . Debuting John Glenn keeps this moving at an incredibly fast pace and this story about every's favorite super-spy falling in love with an archaeologist is one of author Ian Fleming's best . The film will appeal to James Bond series's buffs but good for fans only ; because this one goes on far too long and has provoked so much debate among 007 followers . Rating : 6'5 , well worth watching .","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":97463,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1981-06-25","keywords":"cortina italy,007,albania,blofeld's cat,official bond film","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"For Your Eyes Only","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi123601433","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM3ZGZiMzctNjNhZC00YWVmLTkyZWYtNmM2MTUxZTg1YTYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM3ZGZiMzctNjNhZC00YWVmLTkyZWYtNmM2MTUxZTg1YTYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for this James Bond classic"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000549/","name":"Roger Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000962/","name":"Carole Bouquet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0867694/","name":"Topol"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322515/","name":"John Glen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054040/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0537363/","name":"Richard Maibaum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933865/","name":"Michael G. The Good Liar
programme.desc: Die Goldfische: Directed by Alireza Golafshan. With Tom Schilling, Klaas Heufer-Umlauf, Lisa Bitter, Sabrina Dietel. A good natured comedy about tax evasion and disability." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7689310/","name":"Die Goldfische","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTg2YTMyYjMtMTQ3Mi00OTU4LTlmMDEtYzQ2YjVjNWYxZDA1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDU5MDEyMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A good natured comedy about tax evasion and disability.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7689310/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pricey fish","reviewBody":"Certain things may be hard for us as viewers to connect to. Not being a banker or someone who is detached from human interaction in general, it is not easy to fully identify with the main character here. And there are flaws or at least weird decisions along the way ... but it is a comedy and it tries to be as funny as it can be overall.\n\nThat out of the way, I had no idea what the movie would be like or any story element, so color me shocked and surprised by the inciting incident at the start of the movie. I did not see that coming/happening. After that "bang" the movie takes a minute to breathe a little bit and that is the moment you see the human in our main character. Overall we get quite a few of cliches though, but still it does its best to stay on the right side of funny and delicate when it touches certain subjects. Funny but predictable - still entertaining if you let it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1680,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2019-03-21","keywords":"disability,wilhelm scream","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Die Goldfische","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3829447705","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDZiZjViMDctZWE0Mi00NDdlLThjYzQtN2Q3YWQ0NjEyMmE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDZiZjViMDctZWE0Mi00NDdlLThjYzQtN2Q3YWQ0NjEyMmE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0771713/","name":"Tom Schilling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1678891/","name":"Klaas Heufer-Umlauf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3474804/","name":"Lisa Bitter"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2285783/","name":"Alireza Golafshan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0027692/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0239725/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008261/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2285783/","name":"Alireza Golafshan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1487045/","name":"Justyna Müsch"}],"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Plokhiye dorogi
Złe drogi
Pohani dorogy
programme.desc:
Plokhiye dorogi: Directed by Natalya Vorozhbit. With Zoya Baranovskaya, Oksana Cherkashyna, Vladimir Gurin, Maryna Klimova. Destiny has thousands of ways." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8126172/","name":"Plokhiye dorogi","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTdkYThlYTYtMzE1OS00YzFkLTk3NzctNjZkMWE2NmY3MDNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODkzMzQ3OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Destiny has thousands of ways.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8126172/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cherry_town"},"dateCreated":"2021-08-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Gripping crescendo","reviewBody":"The writer and a director is a household name in Ukraine after she has catapulted herself into fame with the meritorious TV series To Catch the Kaidash.

For the latter, Natalya Vorozhbit has served as the writer and a showrunner. She has transplanted the 19th century classic Ukrainian novel into nowadays reality where all Ukrainians recognized themselves and their troubles and guilty pleasures. The whole country has been swept away with the master craft.

Now Mrs. Vorozhbit has made her way into the big screen, and the start is vertiginous. 100 minutes of the grilling movie is painful experience to stomach and to delve into. As Ukraine goes through the catharsis of the war in the East, one might expect that the movie, especially propped up with a dole of public funds, would transgress into a piece claining, albeit subtly, the righteousness of our case.

Far from it. The war is cruel and demanding for both sides, and especially for those caught in between as the DUI-ed headmaster of Popasna School N3 who launches a string of interconnected novellas.

After the third episode when the gates of the hell seem to have widely open, you are plunged into the seemingly innocent mild road incident when a strayed hen is killed. Would you expect what you see from a pair of peasants whose rusted shaving razors are piled in a filth sink?

It is still evident that the dramaturgic power of Vorozhbit, given her experience, still dominates over her cinematography. Details are gripping as the aftertaste and anticipation of more to come from this ascented star of Ukraine's cinema and theater.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":284,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-05-20","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7223776/","name":"Zoya Baranovskaya"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11937432/","name":"Oksana Cherkashyna"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11745645/","name":"Vladimir Gurin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3770838/","name":"Natalya Vorozhbit"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0673519/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0763401/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3770838/","name":"Natalya Vorozhbit"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

Destiny has thousands of ways." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8126172/","name":"Plokhiye dorogi","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTdkYThlYTYtMzE1OS00YzFkLTk3NzctNjZkMWE2NmY3MDNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODkzMzQ3OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Destiny has thousands of ways.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8126172/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"cherry_town","dateCreated":"2021-08-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Gripping crescendo","reviewBody":"The writer and a director is a household name in Ukraine after she has catapulted herself into fame with the meritorious TV series To Catch the Kaidash.

For the latter, Natalya Vorozhbit has served as the writer and a showrunner. She has transplanted the 19th century classic Ukrainian novel into nowadays reality where all Ukrainians recognized themselves and their troubles and guilty pleasures. The whole country has been swept away with the master craft.

Now Mrs. Vorozhbit has made her way into the big screen, and the start is vertiginous. 100 minutes of the grilling movie is painful experience to stomach and to delve into. As Ukraine goes through the catharsis of the war in the East, one might expect that the movie, especially propped up with a dole of public funds, would transgress into a piece claining, albeit subtly, the righteousness of our case.

Far from it. The war is cruel and demanding for both sides, and especially for those caught in between as the DUI-ed headmaster of Popasna School N3 who launches a string of interconnected novellas.

After the third episode when the gates of the hell seem to have widely open, you are plunged into the seemingly innocent mild road incident when a strayed hen is killed. Would you expect what you see from a pair of peasants whose rusted shaving razors are piled in a filth sink?

It is still evident that the dramaturgic power of Vorozhbit, given her experience, still dominates over her cinematography. Details are gripping as the aftertaste and anticipation of more to come from this ascented star of Ukraine's cinema and theater.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":284,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7,"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-05-20","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7223776/","name":"Zoya Baranovskaya","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11937432/","name":"Oksana Cherkashyna","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11745645/","name":"Vladimir Gurin"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3770838/","name":"Natalya Vorozhbit"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0673519/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0763401/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3770838/","name":"Natalya Vorozhbit"],"duration":"PT1H45M"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Natalya Vorozhbit

programme.title: Days of the Bagnold Summer
Lato Bagnoldów
Days of the Bagnold Summer
programme.desc:
Days of the Bagnold Summer: Directed by Simon Bird. With Monica Dolan, Earl Cave, Elliot Speller-Gillott, Tamsin Greig. A teenager spends his summer listening to heavy metal music and trying to get along with his librarian mom." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7343740/","name":"Days of the Bagnold Summer","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNThjY2VjMjktNGI0Yy00NjMwLWE1YTQtZWE3ZjExZThjODA3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTM5NzYzNTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A teenager spends his summer listening to heavy metal music and trying to get along with his librarian mom.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7343740/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kevinwilliam-08044"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beautifully understated comedy","reviewBody":"Daniel is a morose, thrash metal loving teenager dressed in black with long unkept hair who is painfully unsure of himself. He does not have a great relationship with his mum Sue, who, despite having a sunny disposition and cheery manner is also painfully unsure of herself. Daniel is hoping to spend the summer with his father who is now living in Florida but when that plan is scuppered it's clear that he's going to have to spend it with his mother.

To say this film is understated is....well, an understatement. Some reviews have seen the film as pointless and innocuous and to be fair this directorial debut by actor Simon Bird isn't going to change your life but I found a lot to like. There are plenty of laugh out loud moments a few moving ones (but not overtly sentimental) the direction and photography and the songs of Belle and Sebastian perfectly capture the bright but often deadly dull days of a suburban British summer. The supporting cast is full of great British comic actors who are great although the central performances of Earl Cave and especially Monica Dolan as son and mother are quite wonderful.

Your socks won't be blown off but give yourself 85 minutes to immerse yourself into this world and you will find it, I think, a rather disarmingly charming experience.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1800,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"genre":["Comedy","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2020-06-08","keywords":"teenager","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2582232601","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjJhMmQ4ZGQtMTc3YS00ZTlkLTk5YzQtOWU3MDg0ZjMxMTczXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjJhMmQ4ZGQtMTc3YS00ZTlkLTk5YzQtOWU3MDg0ZjMxMTczXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Sue works in a library. Daniel eats crisps and listens to Metallica. This was the summer Daniel was due to spend with his dad and his dad's new wife in Florida. But when they cancel his trip at the last minute, Sue and Daniel suddenly face the prospect of six long weeks together. An epic war of wills ensues in the unassuming battleground of their suburban home as they each reckon with private tragedies -- and pursue their personal passions."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0230826/","name":"Monica Dolan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5994881/","name":"Earl Cave"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4169846/","name":"Elliot Speller-Gillott"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3020713/","name":"Simon Bird"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0436913/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0495802/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0604063/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10709085/","name":"Lisa Owens"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3680249/","name":"Joff Winterhart"}],"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

Three friends are part of an opposition group in the chaotic Chile of the early 70's and together commit a political crime that changes the history of the country and incidentally involves them in a betrayal that separates them forever." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6131414/","name":"Araña","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjA1ZTU4ZTYtYzNjMS00NGY2LTk1NTEtZGY3MzY1ZTY0OWJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA1Njg0NjI2._V1_.jpg","description":"Three friends are part of an opposition group in the chaotic Chile of the early 70's and together commit a political crime that changes the history of the country and incidentally involves them in a betrayal that separates them forev","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6131414/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"searchanddestroy-1"},"dateCreated":"2020-11-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Unfortunately underrated","reviewBody":"And I am afraid that it will remain underrated, unknown, this so interesting and surprising tale of a group of young idealist, right wing extremists. In the movies speaking of those times, mid seventies, it is always question of left wing groups. This changes a lot, but those young men and women are not the Hitler like fascists, jerks in quest of their own good, their own wealth and fortune. No those young fascists truly believed in a better world, fighting communism and crime in the streets. Look for the scene at the beginning of the film, when the former activist crushes the young robber on the wall with his car. So terrific, brutal and shocking scene, especially when you see the crowd around applaud. And I won't spoil the ending, so disturbing too....A real gem, believe me, from south America. After Argentina years of dictatorship, it is now question of Chile.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":765,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-08-15","keywords":"operation condor,1970s,one word title,love triangle,betrayal","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Tráiler [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1390395161","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGE4NTc1YjctNWRjZC00YWI5LTkzNDgtMDhiMTI4YzIzNDBjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGE4NTc1YjctNWRjZC00YWI5LTkzNDgtMDhiMTI4YzIzNDBjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0608187/","name":"Mercedes Morán"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1482999/","name":"María Valverde"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1448486/","name":"Marcelo Alonso"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0939540/","name":"Andrés Wood"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0276526/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0231304/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0399336/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5979724/","name":"Guillermo Calderón"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: To the Stars
Do gwiazd
To the Stars
programme.desc:
To the Stars: Directed by Martha Stephens. With Kara Hayward, Jordana Spiro, Tina Parker, Shea Whigham. Under small town scrutiny, a withdrawn farmer's daughter forges an intimate friendship with a worldly but reckless new girl in 1960s Oklahoma." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6886080/","name":"To the Stars","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzg4YWIxODMtYThlOC00YjI0LWI4ZjAtMWZlMjc1MzI3MWUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjE4NzUxNDA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Under small town scrutiny, a withdrawn farmer's daughter forges an intimate friendship with a worldly but reckless new girl in 1960s Oklahoma.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6886080/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"aadelman-05792"},"dateCreated":"2019-01-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"First Reaction","reviewBody":"You really don't need to know much more about this film aside from the brief blurb currently posted. A detailed synopsis will actually diminish the experience in my opinion. The film is a black and white production set in 1960s Oklahoma. The story is centrally about an unlikely relationship between two young women. That's as much as you need to know.

From a technical perspective, the depth of field was above average even for a studio production. As an independent film, the photography earns extra points. The production was shot on location so we can't talk about set design. However, the costumes and staging were pretty spectacular too.

I was a little disappointed to learn the film was dual-chromatic. Meaning the producers and director essentially shot both in color and non-color before deciding which cut to release. The film wasn't exclusively crafted as a black and white film. On the upside though, the director obviously took care enough to ensure everything contrasted well in black and white from the beginning. The contrast is very well done and obviously extensively planned.

The best part of the film is probably the performances though. Kara Hayward steals the show in my opinion. However, there is such a long list of supporting roles it's hard to say which one is best. Liana Liberato deserves a mention as an essential co-star but the list really doesn't end there. If I had to level any criticism, I'd say the male performances didn't really keep up.

The difference probably relates more to writing than how the actors were portrayed but the difference is noticeable. All the male characters, with maybe one exception, are decidedly two dimensional. The female characters, whether by acting or writing, display a lot more depth and interest for the viewer. The distinction was obviously intentional. However, there is a problem.

Without giving anything away, the sheer volume of depth almost overwhelms the film at some points. I feel as though there were too many interesting plot lines to explore. The film might have accomplished more with less. Instead, I encountered some odd cropped scenes where you're left wondering where some of the ideas came or went.

Not exactly continuity glitches. More like questions left hanging. I won't tell you the details. Suffices to say though, the climax of the film ends up feeling a bit rushed and most of the sub-plots leave the film feeling inconclusive. One loose end was certainly intentional. However, I'm talking about the film as a whole.

Go watch and enjoy. The film is a lot more successful than not. If you have the time, you should ask yourself where the title came from.
